The Good, The Bad, and The Ugly

There will be a TL;DR at the end.

~

The game falls short of its own shadow in many ways.
It is without character development and story
It is without the variety.
It is with a less consistent/polished core loop.

The testosterone filled glory of the combat swells the brain with glee, but dulls after a few hours.

- Controls Are Awkward - KBM is trash, you’ll need a gamepad, although it’s not much better. You never really get used to it.
- Multiplayer Focus - In case you’re here for the campaign.
- - Repetitive, but not bad,
- Not 40k Faithful - Boltguns tickle enemies, Chew Through rare enemies, blasphemous plot, etc.
- Surprise! - It wants to be a Live Service game.
- Unfinished Grenade UI - they seem the same on HUD ?
- Gun Execute is Blah - at the beginning is super cool;not punchy enough, you end up chaining them together over and over to kill 1 guy.
- Ammo? - It is not precious, but it's also not plentiful.
- FOV - way too shallow
- "Hold to interact" - ew.
- Buggy - Including enemies shooting through walls, not picking up items, clipping, and more.
- Missing Features - Can’t snap to targets. Needed for controller.
- No squad customization - ???
- No Troop Variety - Never fight beside mechanical troopers or mercs. Sad.
- None of the little soldiers ever survive - :(
- Campaign Overstays Welcome - It's a 5-6 hour experience in an 8-9 hour package.
- Very Stingy on healing - Awkward unlike other games in the medium.

- Bullet Sponge Enemies - Dump 3 clips of bolter ammo into a normal guy’s head.
- Stun Locks - Get messed up and tossed around sometimes.
- Antithetical Dance - Combat stutters and fails to flow.
- No Upgrades in Campaign - All the cools stuff is in Multiplayer.
- Lack Of Mechanical Depth - Tastes like a cake missing ingredients
- Sound is off - voice is especially low.
- Flat characters - Unsurprising and uninteresting.
- No collectables - ????!?
- Health Sponge - Armor is fickle, and your health is constantly chipped down with few ways to earn it back.
- AI allies are goofy - and enemies disregard them.
- Invasive "Always Online" BS - Makes it harder to enjoy at times.
- NDA and Information Harvesting - I don’t usually have to sell my soul to play a game.
- Was that my gun? - Non-dynamic weapon models for cutscenes. C’MON IT’S 2024!
- Pinning animations are too long - repeating several times.
- Bosses are boring bullet sponges - Not mechanically challenging, just take forever.
- No Controller Presets where swapping weapons is NOT on the D-Pad - You will be doing this constantly
- Weapons don't feel like wins - they all feel like losers in some way.
- Pathetic weapon variety - They look drab and insultingly similar, they play the same.
- Bosses are normal enemies? - For some they just slap a big healthbar on a normal Elite enemy and recycle others.
- Neutral melee attacks… - cause your character to turn around and not attack where you're facing.

- Solid flow - fans rejoice!
- 2010's goodness - Simplicity!
- throwback - "Cooridor Shooter" vibes in a good way.
- Great Enemies! - Tyanid/Zerg foes are super fun to blast away at!
- Looks gorgeous - Pleasing to the senses!
- Music can be inspiring! - Swelling overtones!
- Juicy - Tons of executions and combat punch
- Guns sound powerful! - Even if they don’t do much, you feel like a beast
- Fun with Friends! - Everything is, but this is a good experience to share!
- Satisfying Destruction! - My therapist recommends this.
- Lots of cool locations! - No longer stuck on the machine world of !
- Nerds Rejoice! - Lots of little goodies for 40k fans!
- Lots of variety! - Modes, Modes, MODES! Throwback to 2009 with how much content!

is fun for a time. It’s novel for 40k fans who will enjoy the tropes, much like many star wars folks these days. Hyper dramatic combat loop dazzles at first and fizzles without variety, but keeps you engaged to get your money’s worth. Made me want to read the books, had novel vibes at times in a good way. It's more of the original Space Marine 1 without too much added, and that’s good in and of itself. The game has a AAA look and a mid-range feel; while suffering from the issue of having lots of enemies to kill and not enough resources to do so efficiently.

~


is a game.
It’s not gonna blow anyone’s mind or shake up the market - and in many respects it’s a throwback to over 12 years ago when times were simpler. While several shortcomings might keep it from being top shelf, it will certainly be a good time that’s worth your attention.

不是卡加载服务器就是卡加载，根本玩不了，如果你想主打多人请把服务器整好点。

TLDR - The game is great but the initial experience during the early access was atrocious for co-op. I highly recommend it now but I can't leave a thumbs up for paying to play a Beta test for their co-op servers. Co-op was advertised ages ago, it should've worked for everyone in all regions.

My initial experience before the server maintenance:-
Get yer damn co-op servers running. We can barely play together dangit. It has bee 6 hours of being in game, half that time was either me looking at "Joining server" or my friend experiencing the same. And when we do play... it's not so bad. Game's pretty fun. But hot damn get the servers workin.

Another 7ish hours later and the co-op servers still suck.
Tried all the possible fixes on the internet and still nothing.
This game was advertised to having co-op so you'd expect to have it on the get go.

After the server maintenance:-
The co-op finally works.
No work around, no fiddling with the settings, just share your code and there's your friend in the lobby. The squad works in all game modes. I'm having fun and I'm enjoying everything the game has to offer and am excited to see what comes next on the road map.

If you wanna know more about the game itself check out the other reviews cause they can probably do a better job explaining it.

With all that said, first impressions count and that initial roller coaster of nothingness still has a lingering impact. We were told we could play the game early if we bought it early. Apparently, that only applied to certain people and in certain regions. Some people got their moneys worth while others didn't. As much as I want to leave a thumbs up for the game, I can't. I can tell you the game's good now overall but that's as far as it goes. I don't usually pre-order games but hot damn it was never bad enough to write a review about it.
На мою девушку упал космодесантник.

Prinzipiell ein gutes Spiel, aber ich kann einfach nicht guten Gewissens Faulheit supporten. Aber was bedeutet das?

Grafisch ist das Spiel sehr gut, kein Meisterwerk aber bedenkt man wie viele Gegner gleichzeitig im Spiel sind is das schon ok. Ich spiele auf 4k mit ner 7900XTX und nem Alienware Oled Monitor. Alles auf max und man hat zwischen 40-80 FPS also sehr gut optimiert. Leider kein HDR support.

Die Story ist halt totaler Schwachsinn wenn man sich mit dem Lore auskennt, der ganze Planet müsste voll von Space Marines sein damit man überhaupt ne Chance hat, aber gut is halt ein Spiel das is auch ok.

Wo kommt die Faulheit ins Spiel? Beim Kampfsystem, eigentlich könnte das ein geiler Shooter sein aber die Entwickler erzwingen einen Mix aus Nahkampf und Fernkampf damit hab ich kein Problem Darktide hat das ja sehr gut gemacht.

Aber hier ist das extrem schlecht umgesetzt, man bekommt nur aufs Maul weil man konstant umzingelt ist das Spiel baut darauf auf das man das aushalten kann, was mich stört ist das die Gegner KI speziell die Fernkämpfer nur und explizit den Spieler angreifen, große Gegner wie der Carnifex können Fernkampfangriffe komplett abblocken, mit 2 Schwertern ja ne is klar. Höhere Schwierigkeitsgrade sind total lame gemacht einfach Gegner hat jetzt mehr HP und macht mehr Damage. Bei den Nahkampfangriffen hat man sich gedacht wenn man nach jedem Hit so ne art Lag einbaut verpasst das den Schlägen mehr Wucht aber es nerft total, aber anscheinend bin ich der einzige den das stört. Fernkämpfer treffen einen auch immer wenn man nicht aktiv ausweicht, also nur in Bewegung bleiben hilft eigentlich nicht.

Im Prinzip ist es WWZ im Warhammer Universum die Tyraniden klettern sogar exakt gleich wie die Zombies wo rauf.

Ich denke wenn man das im Coop mit echten Menschen spielt is es sicher ganz lustig aber mit Bots fallen die Schwächen halt total auf. Wenn man hier keinen Spacemarine spielen könnte sondern das irgend ein anderes Setting wäre könnt ich mir gut vorstellen das das Spiel auch gefloppt wäre.

Objektiv wäre Darktide das bessere Spiel WENN sich Fatshark dazu herabgelassen eine Kampange einzubauen oder irgendetwas mit der Story zu machen.

Fazit: Kann man sich durchaus gönnen, wenn das Geld knapp is auf nen Sale warten das dauert sicher nicht lange kurz vor Weihnachten. Es ist ein gutes Spiel wird dem Hype aber nicht gerecht. Aus dem Kampfsystem hätte man echt mehr rausholen können.

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine II

Pros:
+ Plenty of WH40k lore, references and easter eggs... Warhammer 40k fans will be pleased
+ Truly an epic campaign
+ Looks great
+ Gameplay is solid, brutal, bloody and gives a good challenge on higher difficulties
+ Soundtrack
+ 6 unique classes for PVE and PVP
+ Great optimazation
+ Polished, no bugs ( except Tyranids )


- No Chaos customization in multiplayer, you can only changes their color not a single piece of armor
- Only 3 maps for multiplayer... truly a heresy
- 3 multiplayer modes aren't much better... Team Deatmatch, Capture point and Mobile Capture Point. Truly nothing special.
- For me game takes literally few minutes to quit... faster is just to press ALT+F4
- Though 6 PVE scenarios that we curently have are pretty good, on longer run they will lack replayability


- Campaign takes around ~10 hours to finish
- Multiplayer have 3 maps and 3 game modes
- There's 6 PVE scenarios each take around ~30 minutes
- There's 23 weapons, some are available only in campaign like Flamethrower
神皇在上，救救我被该死混沌盯上的战友，他看不见了，他说我和敌人都隐身了，这一定是奸奇的阴谋，异端邪祟，杀杀杀！

Только 6 кооп миссий, надоедают уже на 3 круг прохождения.
Прокачка с минимальным выбором внутри класса и максимально уныло затянута. Ты чувствуешь, что убиваешь врагов на 3-4 сложности, только где-то на 20+ уровне когда открыл наконец-то перки под нужное тебе оружие.
Отсутствие патронов в половине сегментов миссии, очень весело играть, если в пачке нет саппорта(нет).
Пвп просто кал, особенно когда в половине каток у тебя хост кал и у всех пинг 80+ с потерей пакетов. Да и в коопе куча раз было, что просто не грузит и надо перезапускать игру.
Зажатие кнопок и особенно лифты заебали еще на стадии кампании, кампания прикольная на раз, жаль механики с боссов не перенесли в операции.
Игра чисто на раз пройти и забыть, её спасёт только добавление кооп миссий и желательно в разы больше чем 1 в месяц какой-нибудь.
Клянусь быть упорным и праведным в своем служении, и да поглотит тьма мою душу, если я окажусь недостойным

The game is tough, brutal and has some really visceral combat. If you love Warhammer 40k and enjoyed the first you will absolutely love the second game. The scale has been impressive it feels like fighting huge zergs of enemies and if you play as Co-op you will have a blast with friends.

워해머 세계관의 TPS 슈팅 게임 스페이스 마린의 후속작

오래되어서 기억이 하나도 나진 않지만 전작을 꽤 재밌게 했던 이미지가 남아있어서

나름 기대를 하면서 골드 에디션을 구입, 어드밴스드 억세스로 4일 먼저 플레이 해보았다.



오프닝 동영상과 몰려오는 저글링같은 적들을 쓸어담고 나니

게임에 대한 기대가 올라갔지만 그 기대는 오래가지 않았다.



상당히 큰 행성급 스케일 전투와 그에 대한 연출로 볼거리는 꽤 있지만

스테이지의 구성 자체가 이동 - 전투 - 이동 - 전투의 느낌을 강하게 받고

진행에 따른 캐릭터의 성장요소나 스킬 습득 같은 추가 요소들이 거의 없다시피 해서

코어 게임플레이에 상당히 의존적이며 깊이감이 부족함을 느낀다.

적들의 종류나 인상적인 보스전이 많이 없는 것도 이런 느낌을 가속화시킨다.



캠페인에 있으면 좋았을 스킬이나 무기 레벨업은 PvE모드에는 존재하는데

정작 PvE 미션 자체가 6개밖에 없는데다가 난이도 단계를 제외하면

굳이 반복을 해서 플레이할만한 동기부여나 재미를 찾기 힘들다.



그래도 게임플레이 자체가 기본적인 TPS 슈팅 게임의 재미는 충족시켜주고 있어서

한번정도 캠페인 + PvE 미션을 깨는 재미는 있겠지만

요즘 시대에 풀프라이스 (정가 79800원, 4일 먼저 하려면 104800원) 로

이정도 깊이와 컨텐츠는 좀 부족하지 않나 하는 생각이 들었다.

Buy. It.

Basing this off of the singleplayer campaign, I'd give this game a neutral review if I could, I enjoyed some parts of it and some parts not so much. First off the game does look and sound amazing and does Warhammer 40,000 every bit of justice it possibly can, there's tons of detail everywhere and the environments and scale of the enemy hordes are seriously impressive. And it's not just a cosmetics thing, you can see the swarms climbing walls and such and you can destroy them. The basic combat once you get used to the parry and dodge system works pretty well and the weapons feel like they all have a use; I tried to use most of the weapons I picked up during my playthrough and there were few straight up upgrades, more like sidegrades.

The structure of the missions is very linear and there's generally very few things to find apart from audio logs. At the start of the game it felt like you got obstructed very often, I kept walking into invisible walls, but I think the game opens up later on more and the midway part of the campaign had the best mission variety. Sadly I think the campaign falls off towards the end, but other than that, I mostly had a good time. I wish the jetpacks would have been used more in missions.

Now onto the things I didn't like; the whole campaign seems designed more for co-op play than singleplayer. The AI teammates are generally very bad at covering you while doing objectives (+ they cannot do objectives themselves), and you'll regularily get pinned down by ranged enemies all the time, so in every encounter you have to hyperfocus the ranged enemies down first because the AI won't be doing that. At first I started the campaign on Veteran difficulty and I found it to be too annoying to complete with the AI so I switched to Normal after a couple missions and had a much better time. But still the squad AI could really be better, the game should offer a more balanced singleplayer experience. (EDIT: This was improved in patches which is good!)

Also (potential spoilers warning), the campaign isn't very long, I finished it in just about 11 hours, while generally taking my sweet time to explore as well. Towards the end it's like they forgot the beginning of the invasion (Tyranids) completely and the ending felt very cliche and Disney like. I did like that they introduced more enemies later on and I'm a fan of different than usual Chaos factions being represented but it felt like there should have been more story missions across all the planets. I know there's the Operations mode and Eternal War, and I expect that'll add a lot more playtime, but the main campaign felt quite short. (EDIT - Operations has been quite fun if a bit grindy, Eternal War is a pretty typical pvp mode and could use more interesting maps and customization imo)

The game ran well on my laptop with an i9 13980 HX, 32 GB RAM and Nvidia 4090 RTX 16 GB; on 2560x1600 resolution I could play it on high settings with ultra textures (without any upscaling), getting between 60-80 FPS. Some of the larger fights dipped as low as 50 but not below that. I'll probably test how it runs at 4K later on but I'd expect it to require some DLSS at least.

I didn't like that the game has no support for aspect ratios other than 16:9, so at 16:10 I had constant black bars on my screen all the time and it should really be fixed as it's a standard feature in PC games. Also, there was no support for inverted horizontal camera controls for gamepad, so I couldn't play it on gamepad since I use fully inverted controls (both vertical + horizontal) in all games I play; another thing that should be fixed and added to options. Had to learn to play on keyboard & mouse instead :p

TL;DR:
Solid gameplay; nice WH40K aesthetic; poor AI and mission design more for co-op; short campaign that falls off towards the end; some annoying missing technical features

Edit: I'm switching some categories around and migrating my overall reason for not recommending the game to lean more towards the incredibly unstable matchmaking system.

Pros
-Intense and dynamic combat
-Great graphics
-Interesting story so far
-Multiplayer is fun and addicting (have not tried PvP yet)
-There's a nice blend of needing to use all weapons at your disposal

Cons
-Friendly bot AI is not the best. They seem to be randomly aggressive and passive at weird intervals.
-The matchmaking system is quite unstable, leading to excessive load screens. I don't actually believe this is a server performance issue, I think it's how the matchmaking system is currently designed. *If a player queues for quick match and...: 1. gets a mission they don't like and leaves the squad. 2. does not want to be a party leader and leaves the squad / quits to title screen. ...this seems to have a direct impact on the players who get pulled into the queue of this player that did not stick around. I believe (not a confirmed fact) this is why we see a lot of "joining server" load screens that take a long time. I want to say the game is not optimized for dealing with these scenarios.

Pro/Con
-Ammo economy can be rough in some points of missions and can make progression more difficult than expected. Learning to search crates for ammo and being wise with ammo consumption helps with this.
-There is a strong focus on needing to use the parry system. Some people may hate that, others may not. Once you get the hang of it though, your gameplay improves quite a bit.
-Incoming damage is a bit rough, especially melee attacks, but this does condition you to block, parry, and improve movement more.
-There is an intense amount of grinding needed to achieve progression in multiplayer. Some may see this as a good thing to stay motivated to play, others may think it's too much of a grind fest and not enjoy it.
-Restricting multiplayer play to one class per player. This creates diversity however is an immediate generation of frustration for players who can't consistently play the class they wish to play.

Overall, I am enjoying the game. However, I would like to see some improvements before I feel I can confidently recommend the game.

This game feels like its from a bygone age, one where Microsoft and Xbox were putting up a fight (and maybe even winning) against Sony in the Console Wars. Its great.

An entertaining linear story mode at around 5-6 hours (on Normal mode), though for maximum enjoyment you should have played or at least seen a recap of Space Marine 1. (And/or understanding Warhammer 40K lore)

A 3 man Co-op "Operations" mode that sees you play as your own different Marines that you can customize head to toe (from 6 different classes) and go on missions with other aspiring recruits/players trying to level up and score better gear.

Though at the moment there are only 6 missions to complete. They mostly feel good to play through, and multiple runs are needed to upgrade and level up your Space Marine.

(This is also the live-service, seasonal part of the game so expect content updates unless something completely unexpected happens).

There is also a very fun but very dry no nonsense PVP akin to old COD lobbies but without the vulgarities, racism, and probably no no-scopes (yet).

Hope the devs update this "Eternal War" mode as well cause there is some good building blocks to work with.

Combat is very fun, consisting of dodges and parries to outmaneuver and counterattack the enemy respectively.

Not too much to learn other than the timings of parries/dodges and melee combos of each weapon but the chaotic horde-style gameplay will still sometimes give you problems even if you have mastered the intricate art of murdering other Alien lifeforms.

8.5/10 or 9/10 if you are already a fan of 40K.

Ну что сказать. Ожидания были большими. А в итоге получился пук, начнем по порядку:
1. Боевка полная шляпа. Что либо можно сделать в бою 1 на 1. как только встречаешься с двумя 3 крупными жуками все парирования увороты и прочее идет лесом. Справится с толпой можно только если это обычная хурма.
2. Стрельба пистолеты болтеры плазма и прочее почти бесполезна. можно конечно ради прикола пострелять но в общем и целом это почти бессмысленно.
3. Сюжетной компании почти нет. Все заточено на не очень интересный кооп. А заставки перед миссией где вы и ваши компаньоны сидят внутри корабля вообще пахнут сессионными поделками.
4. миссии однотипны и скучны. походи по туннелю, подерись с жуками, посмотри как они лезут на стену друг по другу.
5. Диалоги Моряков отдельный калл. Про бек вселенной опять говорить не приходится.
6. Костаминации персонажа нет, от слова совсем, все что можно поменять это скинчики из длс. ждем боксы с ключами.
7. В онлайн не играл но вспоминая первую часть и учитывая геймплей этой части там творится полный ад.
Подведя итоги , даже моя безмерная любовь ко вселенной и с любовью воссозданный разработчиком антураж далекого будущего не делают этот кусок говна игрой. 10 смут из 10.

Regrettably i am leaving a negative review pointing out the serious shortcomings of Space Marine 2 as a veteran Vermintide/Darktide player who loves 40k lore.

- During the first launch of the game, Epic games online components are installed automatically without a prompt screen. I do not want it in my computer. You have to go through loops to uninstall it. There is a reason why i am using steam and steam only and i want the developers to respect it.
- When compared with Darktide, Dawn of War series and especially Mechanicus, Space Marine 2 has the weakest music OST. Looks like it was not even at top ten of the priority list during development.
- As a cheap attempt, the game is trying to draw more attention by Twitch drops.
- Very terrible companion ai. One of the worst i have seen for years. They do not use their ranged weapons in most cases and run gret distances to melee an enemy regarless of the class. And they very rarely execute a stunned elite enemy who is only two feet away from them. Such a shame.
- No FOV slider.
- Holding buttons to activate the abilities, instead of hitting them, is a terrible design choice.
- Throwing a frag grenade takes two seconds, activating cloak takes another 2.5 seconds. Character gets hit during uncancellable animations. Every movement and ability use feels unresponsive and stiff during the campaign and multiplayer. Runningg gets interrupted for no reason even if you are holding shift and not even hit by anything.
- Uncancellable dodge, roll over and similar animations are the primary reason why i keep dying. Controls feel very unresponsive.
- Boss fights are almost identical. Area attacks such as some form of 3 round mortar shots, melee charge attacks, ranged attacks and one big 3-wave either green or purple wide area attack which can hit even behind cover is the same rinse and repeat mechanic for both tyranid and chaos bosses.
- Melee combat is terribly designed. Interruptions are common and costs the player half of his health points.
- Ranged weapons feel weak. An elite enemy (Not a boss or a lecter) takes 30 to 40 bolter rounds to put down. Crossing bone swords makes the enemy immune to ranged damage even if you hit the legs, head or spray it from sides.
- The enemies i have mentioned above are bullet sponges but a hit from them take out half of your hp.
- Crowd control options are limited to grenades. I suggest developers to play Vermintide and Dark Tide to see how it is perfected during many years.
- There is a hideous terrible jetpack mission. I hated it.
- Multiple 'Loading resources - loading logic' screens.
- Entire multiplayer lobby system has to be redesigned. It is bad.
- You cannot inject your allies with the stimpack you have in your inventory.
- PVP section of the game is the worst. Very unbalanced. Is this game not beta-tested?
- Cheaters are out there already. I have already witnessed speedhacks and maphacks.
- Easy Anticheat is known as how 'Easy' it is to bypass it. A bad choice from the developers.
- The number of the co-op missions is very few. These missions in general feel rushed, unfinished and exteremely repetitive with very little variation. Even the spawn locations are more or less the same.
- Unlocking armor pieces or better versions of the same weapon is very grindy. This is how the game targets longevity.
- The game becomes boring and repetitive very quickly. I do not expect it to have a long lifespan.
- I was unable to pickup some medkits, ammo boxes or grenades even i had the inventory slot available. Pickup prompt was not there.
- Ranged enemies shoot with 120% accuracy and every shot lands perfectly.
- There is a shield or armor mechanic which recharges a specific amount with combo kills. This mechanic is not working as intended and definitely not user friendly.

Cnclusion: 6/10. Wait for a discount or buy the cheapest package if you must. After the hype is dead, the game will no longer be played by most of us. I believe that Space Marine 2 would be a great game if it was released 10 years ago.

This game is exactly what Warhammer 40k aspires to be. And maybe even more.

The Dawn of War series was built around the already long-time established Warhammer 40k IP, but it came out SO GOOD that it appeared to be an even better embodiment of the setting than the "original" itself. And so, paradoxically, GW started to take insipration from DoW themselves, further developing the 40k setting as we know it today.

And I think that Space Marine 2 is yet another brilliant game like this. One that takes inspiration from the 40k's unique atmosphere, but nails it so well, that it will now determine the development of the IP for years to come.

Resumen:
Un juego como los de antaño (que tampoco hay que irse muy lejos), con una historia fenomenal, tiros a mansalva, mecánicas muy difíciles y a veces frustrantes, pero que una vez superas el nivel de gratificación es elevado. Su historia, es espectacular y que todo warhammero o fan de la acción disfrutará y la caracterización de los personajes es sublime, como debería ser en todos los juegos.

Historia:
Simplemente brillante, aunque no seas un fan de warhammer 40k y vengas a buscar tiros, la historia y como se va desarrollando de cara al final es exquisito, el poder vivir las conversaciones del capitulo entre soldados, la nave, su jerarquía, el resto de facciones que aparecen, personajes excelentemente bien definidos y maduros (en esta epoca woke de agenda 2030 donde todos son adolescentes y los hombres no son hombres es extraño, por eso hay que recalcarlo). No esperes nada más, acción a raudales como cualquier Gears of War lo fue en su momento y a disfrutar como un enano.

Gráficos:
Espectacular es quedarse corto, a medida que avanza la historia y las particulas van tomando más papel, la experiencia de cada nivel va en aumento. Los tiranidos son geniales y las misiones contra ellos también, pero de cara a la mitad/final toma otro concepto. Además el poder vivir la batalla en pleno terreno con los astra militarum y el resto del capítulo es increible. Super inmersivo.

Jugabilidad:
Aquí es donde puede fallar, SM2 el juego te introduce la idea de jugar en difícil y con los 4 tips que te dan de forma bastante regular hace que sea muy frustrante, cuesta mucho pillarle el tranquillo al juego y saber cuando defenderte de los 4 tiros que te pegan y te dejan en el suelo. Pero admito que de cara a la mitad cuando ya podía entender como jugarlo empecé a disfrutar muchisimo. No te esperes una nueva invención, pero dentro de su simplicidad es justo lo que vienes buscando, acción, tiros y matar tropecientos enemigos.

Importante:
Nada de agenda politica feminista en el juego. Los hombres son hombres, las mujeres mujeres y la historia se centra en eso: Warhammer 40k, no de quién es mejor que otro o como un género se cree otro. Es como eran los juegos hace 5 años antes de toda la agenda política. Aquí te puedes sentar y DISFRUTAR de una aventura de acción. Lo que temo es que de cara al próximo le vayan a meter agenda, así que igual estaremos disfrutando del último titulo de occidente que es para la gran mayoria del mercado.

Esperemos que no!

En fin, por el emperador!!!

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 – A Brutal War in the Grim Darkness of the Future! (ฅ'ω'ฅ)

"An exhilarating, gory, and action-packed sequel that lives up to the scale of the Warhammer 40K universe, but with some notable flaws in balance and technical polish."


Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 thrusts players into the brutal and unrelenting world of the Warhammer 40K universe, continuing the tale of the Ultramarine Captain Demetrian Titus. Developed by Saber Interactive, this third-person action game places you in the superhuman armor of a Space Marine as you combat the horrifying Tyranid swarm in intense, blood-soaked battles. Building on the success of its predecessor, Space Marine 2 offers solo and co-op gameplay, featuring both player-versus-environment (PvE) and player-versus-player (PvP) modes to keep the action fresh and chaotic.


The moment you step into Titus' power armor, the scale of Space Marine 2’s combat becomes apparent. The game’s standout feature is its seamless combination of gunplay and melee combat, allowing players to switch between devastating bolter shots and brutal close-quarters executions. The spectacle of mowing down endless Tyranid swarms is both thrilling and terrifying, thanks to the sheer number of enemies onscreen, powered by Saber’s Swarm Engine.

The visuals are equally impressive, capturing the grim, gothic aesthetic of the 40K universe. From the ruined hive cities to the expansive battlefields littered with the corpses of xenos and humans alike, the game never shies away from its dark atmosphere. The orchestral score and guttural sounds of bolters firing and chainswords revving heighten the sense of chaos, making every battle feel cinematic.

However, the combat system, while exhilarating, does suffer from balance issues. Melee attacks dominate the battlefield, often making ranged weapons feel underpowered, particularly when faced with larger enemies. The tactical depth you'd expect from wielding the mighty bolter or plasma gun is somewhat diminished by their lack of punch, especially when it inexplicably takes a full magazine to down a basic Tyranid warrior. This can lead to frustrating moments, especially for players who prefer a ranged combat style.

The co-op and PvP modes are a welcome addition, extending the game’s replayability. Operations, the co-op missions, allow players to team up with friends to tackle harder challenges, but the real test comes in the PvP mode, Eternal War, where teams of Space Marines face off against the forces of Chaos. Both modes offer progression systems with plenty of unlockable perks and cosmetics, though the limited variety in mission design can make long play sessions feel repetitive.













Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 delivers on its promise of fast, bloody, and exhilarating combat in the vast and unforgiving Warhammer 40K universe. The game’s atmospheric design, gripping story, and expansive multiplayer modes make it a must-play for fans of the franchise and action games alike. However, the imbalance between melee and ranged combat, along with some technical glitches, prevent it from reaching its full potential.

For those who love diving into the lore of Warhammer or who are looking for a gory, action-packed co-op experience, Space Marine 2 is a solid recommendation. Just don’t expect a perfectly polished experience or to rely heavily on your bolter.


If you enjoyed this review, make sure to follow our curator page for more in-depth Warhammer 40K content and action game recommendations. Join the fight against the xenos, and let’s cleanse the galaxy together! For the Emperor!ヽ(´• ω •`)ノ

品9月9忆战斗兄弟

呱！好劲口牙！

阔别13年，再次跟随 泰爷爷的脚步 体验让每个40K人下体湿湿 的 终极体验吧！！
其中包括且不限于：
成为神秘组织一员！
战斗，爽！！
获得免费升级
手撕虫虫！！
在城里溜圈，围观斗蛐蛐
狂挤番茄酱！！
各种建筑爆破
所有人都敬爱我，见了我都要下跪！！

在墓园刨人祖坟
手撕小鸡！！
看大怪兽踩小人
狂放彩色烟火！！
领导亲自带头做项目，与你互通有无
在庆功宴上走上人生巅峰！！

在新世代的画面加持下，这一份40K的战场震撼独此一家，在众多一言难尽的40K游戏里也算是拔尖的了

但是 为什么 是 不推荐咧？

因为我玩了 死亡天使 难度 以及 对于游戏一些设计的不解

单人游戏中：
臭名昭著的电梯守4链条就不说了 还能说是对于你杀敌效率有一定要求 要灵活运用场景资源过关 用榴弹爆弹枪直接榴弹轰链条还是可以马上清掉翼虫的

但是机械教资料库开发电机 我就不太能理解了场景需要你使用喷火器驱逐撕裂虫 同时开启发动机并且守护一段时间
ok 但是为什么会在需要时刻用短手远程保持环境安全的情况下 设置需要长手远程才能处理的脑虫？

手枪可以管 ok 但是 死亡天使 难度导致 脑虫肉肉 不换大枪打的话 在4，5只近远程武士虫和2，30只刀虫对你蓝圈红圈的猛攻下手枪几乎无法在不瞄准的情况下把脑虫打到红温

ok 那我能不能先高效清理地面然后再干脑虫咧？ 但是 死亡天使 难度 导致 所有虫虫肉肉 普通双刀武士虫 也需要两套连招或者两个枪决才能打出红温 同时还要时刻注意地上的小蝌蚪

喷火器能不能虫虫烧烤呢？ 可以捏 但是火太亮了， 看不清蓝圈红圈， 只能和虫虫互相欧拉了， 一不小心就被在天上狂放红圈的卑鄙虫虫给滋死了

那就换大枪吧。。。为什么捡枪要有1.5秒的确认圈圈。。。什么血包也要1.5秒？。。。手雷也要。。。明明 子弹就是瞬间拿的。。。

最后自己红温了，狂拍手雷技能打药回血发电机秦王绕柱AI引怪不停猥琐手枪射击，在人极度愤怒的情况下，过了。
感觉核心问题是 死亡天使 难度下， 似乎虫虫变肉了。老兵难度下武士虫1个枪决加2，3刀（1套半连招）便能红温 而死亡天使 则需要2个枪决加2，3刀（两套半连招）才能红温

而我们的泰爷爷从头到尾无论是老兵还是死亡天使都用着他那平平无奇的3+爆弹枪（其他武器也是都是基础值），导致低难度是爆弹枪 高难度是滋水枪。而战役过程中没有任何的升级内容，导致即使与最终boss决斗时泰爷爷用的还是白板数值的爆弹枪，不愧为传奇蓝精灵。

多人游戏PVE中：
“哎呀哎呀 这游戏单人就是走个过场撑个牌面 爽就完了 干嘛纠结这个呀” 对 你说的没有错 我认为这个游戏的情怀G点在单人而游戏性亮点就在多人！我只尝试了PVE，故PVP暂不做评论。

看得出制作组花了大精力打造了6个职业 每个职业近20种特性 近二十把武器每把武器更是有多样变种以及升级，颇有暗潮的感觉。 任务皆为剧情中给泰爷爷打下手的副队行动，和剧情一样4个难度。看了武器的升级选项，原来泰爷爷的3+爆弹枪最后可以变成9+，怪不得 死亡天使 难度这么难 原来最精锐的蓝精灵全在主战场外（红温了）

3个近战职业（狂战，刺客，坦克）3个远程职业（步枪，狙，机枪哥）每个职业换着玩也是能体验到各种乐趣 泰爷爷是啥？泰爷爷职业就是爷，爷开技能能回血！

但是游戏的一些设定始终让我有点摸不着头脑：
生命值回复：似乎游戏中并没有各类PVE游戏中存在的休息站，只有换装备的武器站，地图里也只有寥寥无几的血包需要在三个蓝精灵之间分配，导致血量在任务中会越打越少。除了少数职业有“在XX情况下回复1%血量”或者“30%血量下，只要XX就能恢复5%血量”这种回血的天赋，大多数人只能靠倒了拉起和死了重生来恢复自己的状态。特别在高难度合作下的确是个问题。

护盾值：明显制作组希望玩家多打枪决，多打处决来回盾以此减少对血条的压力，虽然处决是有无敌时间的，但是 似乎 好像 枪决 是会被红圈攻击打断的。处决动画是很帅啦但是也满长的，比如说虫虫红温了我是机枪哥我可能跟倾向于直接继续扫，继续多扫两枪出枪决标了，1枪秒了，接着扫别的虫虫。 感觉在实战中大多数人差不多也是团战快打完了才会挑红温的虫虫回状态，我觉得更好的情况是，精英虫和刀虫处决一样 1秒到2秒这样或许会对于近战职业更加友好。

捡东西：1.5秒，为什么？补弹药？Ok的，回满状态，有点小惩罚，理解。枪？怕拿错枪，好吧。手雷？是怕我换错手雷嘛。血包？怕我多拿血包？一般性设计等待圈是因为物品有多种用途或者和别的行为按键冲突，或者是物品重叠，又或者是重要抉择关键物品。残血一路刺激溜虫好不容易看见了个血包&手雷结果不能路过捡起（红温了）

敌人提示：背后出现红圈提示，你猜是啥。是武士虫十字斩我，还是脑虫朝我丢粑粑，还是蛇虫刺我屁屁还是刀斧虫要来扑倒我了。 脑虫粑粑丢两下，可能还是射线要延迟躲。唯一能被认出来的只有狙击虫的射线。这还未涉及到混沌部分。辨别场上有哪些精英全靠好人队友标点，特别是泰伦一家子在一团一起冲过来，光武士虫就4个变体，真的没法立马认出来，更不用说背后偷袭的卑鄙小人了。暗潮好歹还给精英上个大绿夜视仪头上插点图腾，说点骚话让你有逼数。这一团白白紫紫张牙舞爪的也没啥特殊音效，3，4个武士虫混个蛇虫被插才知道。

人群控制：清群溜怪，PVE经典桥段。有没有懂哥说一下？ 我感觉似乎就是靠近战哥吸怪，两人狂射，近战哥处决回盾这么个循环。 一旦近战哥拖不住了，而似乎也没有职业拥有嘲讽，推击，阻拦类似的技能，远程哥压力大增。清群武器就大锤和充能动力剑，接着就是机枪，热熔。地图大多开阔地少有走廊房间隘口等能集力绞杀的地点。

然后 6张图，这么多职业，这么多武器，就一个字，肝。暗潮肝4个探员，这里有六个蓝精灵！！但是没有武器词条，天赋也较多为角色被动而不与武器相连，很难想象满级后能有什么动力继续刷。

说了这么多给了个不推荐，因为感觉就现在内容似乎一眼望到头，但是心里也是希望这个游戏能做好的。40K著以出粪游闻名，这几年风向转好但出的游戏也是史味巧克力或者巧克力味史。但是随着行商浪人的出版和9月9忆战斗兄弟的好评反响，马上暗潮月底也要更新武器系统，难道40K人的好日子要来力嘛？
最后希望saber组好好开发，多出图，多出有特色有识别度的敌人，能使玩家开发有趣玩法的天赋，以及我上面所述的一些问题。。求求你改了吧。。。或者有无懂哥让我明白一下到底为啥这么设计。

谢谢大家

Space Marine 2 is fun.

CAMPAIGN

Great, better than the first games in every way, but. A a few gripes of mine, for starters. If you've progressed through the campaign & you weren't the party leader with friends, none of your progress is saved. Your campaign progress is tied to whoever was the party leaders.

So if you want to replay specific missions you would of had to of been the party leader yourself, otherwise you can't play them.

So if you want to continue where you left off, you have to plan it accordingly with your friends and have the same party leader, (harder if you're all in your 30's with jobs and families) or play it all over again solo or as the party leader with a new batch of friends.

Vehicles? Turrets? Anything? Nope. All infantry combat, which is fine, but it felt like a cop out. You're even teased with a tank in one mission, and all it is, is a in game cutscene from A to B, nothing more.

Speaking of cutscenes, although beautifully made, a good chunk of the gameplay is just that.... pre-rendered or in game cutscenes.

Lack of the variety of enemies. There should of been more variants. Once you start going through missions combat sadly starts feeling the same unless a certain point in the game a new enemy is added into the mix for plot/campaign status. But then it quickly looses it's excitement when it just falls in line with everything else and just becomes the norm again.

However despite those gripes, i thoroughly enjoyed it. There is also replay-ability value there if you fancy a go at all three of the main characters of your squad with their different unique abilities. 8/10


CO-OP Missions

I like how they have been designed. They are aligned with the main campaign. They focus on a different squad of AI/characters related to the story that do their plot/story progression on the side unseen from the main campaign. But this time you get to play them. And knowing how certain events happened and why from the eyes of this new squad is a nice touch of story telling.

The added bonus to it is you have a lot more freedom of choice, you have all 6 classes to choose from, play around with, customise and level up. Everything weapons wise is unlocked from the get go so freedom of choice / chance to experiment isn't locked behind a levelling tree.

What you do unlock however is customisation and upgrades for your weapons/gear.

Is the co-op fun? Yes. Is it a bit of a slug fest after you complete the full set of missions based/linked to the campaign? That totally depends on what you personally like. I enjoyed myself, but I don't see myself really ever replaying them again other than to play with friends for a nice chill sesh.

If grinding away against endless hordes of AI is your thing. With games such as Darktide, then this is right up your ally. I've already sunk enough hours into Darktide however to do it all over again. 7/10

Eternal War (PVP)

This is personally my favourite aspect of the game, despite it's current bare bones structure. Levelling and unlocking is accustomed to the usual stuff you see in games such as Call of Duty, level up, unlock new gun, new item, new gear, play away.

It is however a lot more grindier to gain XP and points for skins/customisation items then it's CO-OP counterpart. Which can be challenging for some but rewarding for others.

There are already some very overly powered meta's in game, if you're going against high levels and a majority of your team is low levels, you're going to 9/10 have a very bad time.

Only 3 maps, all that a custom to the three game modes.

Annihilation (Team Deathmatch)
Seize Ground (Domination)
Capture & Control (King of the Hill)

With the three maps, map knowledge is essentially an advantage at this point if you've played longer than others. Their design, look and feel is very symmetrical, it extremely reminds me of Gears of War 1, 2 & 3's Multiplayer Map Design. There are no advantages to which team/spawn you're on, everything spawn and level design wise is balanced.


All in all very fun, challenging but rewarding. 9/10


Needs/Wants in no particular order for the game

BRING DISMEMBERMENT AND GORE INTO PVP, IT'S 40K! I WANT GORE AND BLOOD!

BUFF THE SINGLE AND DOUBLE MELTA GUNS IN PVP, THEY ARE SO INCONSISTENT

A Deathwatch Titus perspective Campaign DLC. I want to see what he got up too during that time. Plus Firstborn space marines look cooler than Primaris anyway.

A Chaos perspective Campaign DLC

A Tyranid perspective Campaign DLC

A Horde/wave mode for CO-OP

New game modes for PVP (Rush from the Battlefield Games)

Larger scaled maps for PVP

More weapons, PLEASE JUST GIVE ME A DAMM SHOTGUN

Allow more customisation/freedom for Chaos & Space Marines on PVP & CO-OP

Galactic Conquest like mode for CO-OP & PVP Events (from the OG Battlefronts)

Make Tyranids a playable faction in PVP

Bigger teams for PVP, 6v6 is far too small, Space Marine 1 had 8v8 and Dreadnaughts

Introduce bigger scale for everything on PVP, maps, team sizes, introduce AI into the battle.
It doesn't feel like you are in 40k, it feels bare bones almost like a Halo online match but with a 40k skin slapped on top. Make it feel like 40k!

The campaign is short, but it was some of the most satisfying gaming I have ever experienced. I've been a gamer for around 40 years. I love the Warhammer 40K universe and eveything was well done and true to the 40K lore. The music, sound effects, visuals, and even colors are all done well. Missions are intense at times and visceral, The final mission was the most cinematic moment I have seen in a game since Mass Effect 3 and I think this topped it. The PVE is fine for those who want to keep playing and grinding for gear. The PVE is a lot of fun as well. It was money well spent.

It was a wonderful change of pace from Helldivers. Unlike Helldivers, there are no bugs at all. Everything seems polished. None of the weapons seem or feel underpowered.

Great game, people who leave negative reviews are just heretics.

In all honesty, i was very hyped for this game and avoided any game play footage or deep dives into the game. pre-purchased as i played the first one and can confidently say, Space Marine was an absolutely great game for its time (Emphasis on for its time. Key factor for this review) So the date of release comes around and i boot up and dive in. I'm going to keep this short and to the point. The Campaign was absolutely amazing, the scenes of battle and fighting through battlefields was amazing and immensely fun. They really captured the feel of 40k with every mission. Superb.... Roughly 8-9 hours later.... Story finished.... And honestly i cant give any reason to come back to this game after finishing the campaign. I had built up in my head that they were going to go down the Hell Divers route with this game and open it up a bit, really expand on the online social aspect of it. But they never. Its a very linear short story which is great mind you. Cant fault the gameplay and story at all. its Space Marine 1 improved, not expanded and that's my problem with it. There are like... 6-8 online operations that you can play as a team online with 2 other players and you can play those over and over again i suppose if you want to unlock different armors etc.... but to what end? To play through the same 6 missions with new armor? There is the online but like Space Marine 1, i just cant recommend it at all. Played one match and noped out of there. Does a linear story at 8 hours long survive in today's climate? I'm not sure. But i would be lying if i said i wasn't disappointed that i'm essentially just uninstalling this game after playing it for 8 hours. Though those 8 hours were fun and very well put together story wise. If you're fine with a linear 8 hour story with some side content sprinkled in to top it off then i would say go for it. If you were hoping for more to get engaged with and dive in deeper, i just cant justify getting it for the price. Its Space Marine improved.... Not expanded.

Tras mas de 10 años del anterior juego, el teniente Titus regresa para un nuevo servicio con los ultramarines, entregando un combate donde la lucha cuerpo a cuerpo es más importante que los disparos, pero se complementan bien en una campaña brutal que mezcla entornos perfectamente extraídos del trasfondo de Warhammer 40K, escenas épicas y peleas constantes, solo o en cooperativo.

Se nota que está hecho sobre el motor de WWZ y el combate no es todo lo preciso que gustaría, pero lo compensa con variedad de armas y la posibilidad de ayudarse entre tres. Por contra, cosas como no poder dejar una misión a la mitad por estar unidas al servidor afean un poco la experiencia, pero sigue estando muy alta.

Los modos online son un buen añadido, aunque no los principales.

Un retorno genial y uno de los mejores juegos de W40K hasta la fecha.

Лень расписывать плюсы и минусы, поэтому будут чистые эмоции - это экстаз.
Для фана вахи это абсолютный мастхэв, это тот самый ААА проект который мы столько лет ждали, постановка, сюжет, знаковые персонажи - просто сидишь и визжишь как ребенок. Эпик только увеличивается с каждой миссией и в целом компания идет столько сколько нужно. Куча крутых постановочных сцен, невероятно красивые и детализированные локации - это просто какой-то праздник пафоса и восхищения.

Обычно после прохождения на свежую голову начинаешь выискивать минусы, но тут я просто объективно их почти не вижу, кроме не слишком сбалансированной боевки, где ты в секунду теряешь все хп и без кооператива тащить ласт сложности просто анрил. Но в целом боевка классная, ей буквально не хватает 10-20% шлифовки чтобы можно было всегда тащить на скиле, ибо порой врагов столько, что не успеваешь уклониться, спарировать и плюс нельзя отменять анимации, что тоже порой заставляет получить оплеуху. Но в целом за всю компанию я ни разу не почувствовал чувство духоты и того что я хочу все дропнуть.

Единственное возвращаясь к сложности, я задушился играть на 3 и стал на 2 и даже там видны проблемы баланса, оно не сильно портит впечатления игры именно на 2 сложности, все что выше это не сбалансированный ад, который надо будет исправлять, если бы я пытался пройти все на них, то скорее всего небезосновательно крыл бы матом разрабов как большая часть отрицательных обзоров, так что надеюсь что после полного релиза разработчики как-то это подправят патчами, иначе это неиграбельно.

В общем это на текущий момент самая крутая, масштабная игра по вахе, ее в обязательном порядке должен пройти каждый фанат, и обычный игрок тоже может получить удовольствие и мб даже вкатиться. Я невероятно доволен и приятно поражен что студия превзошла все мои ожидания, даже не касаясь онлайн составляющей, одна компания уже отбивает любую цену, так что с нетерпением жду триквела.

I really like this game it feels great to play and am happy a road map was already shown to address many issues. Though I have a few things I wish they would add and change.

Changes:
- It does not make sense to have operations and pvp not transfer your level in between each other. If I grind my level in operations my level should be the same for pvp so that I can access all the weapons I grinded for.
- make it easier to level up
- Add another class like tech marine, apothecary, chaplain
- Make it so that heretic astartes are not locked in to only 1 class

Additions:
- For pvp they should add execution kills to make the game cooler
- Add a parry mechanic because melee against character feels just like who hits first gurantees a win.
- Buff the assault class it is definitely the weakest class overall. Make the animations fast , maybe give it a stun when it slams in the air and more armor so it does not instantly die and add lightning claws.
- Add more voice lines for the narration and the characters its annoying only hearing the same phrases over and over
- Give the heretic astartes more customization options as it is a bit disappointing that you can only change their color
- add more traitor legions like emperors children, wordbearers, sons of horus, and Thousand sons
- give loyalist unique voicelines for loyalist legions as it was done for heretics
- Add more enemies from different chaos factions other than Tzeetch.

GOTY easily.

You do not feel like a Space Marine in this game.

In singleplayer PVE on just veteran difficulty, which is supposedly the intended experience, even (close to) perfect play rewards you with gameplay of being constantly whittled down by weenies into flickeringly low hp when reacting to all commands perfectly and swiftly headshotting and executing every enemy whilst never being hit by even a single clean attack from anything other than explicitly and only small enemies hitting you during your own melee attack combos on larger ones.

Why is the game this way?
Even supposing this is somehow balanced around multiplayer, the mindset that somehow your hypervulnerability is the right way to accomplish this is just incorrect.

This isn't left for darktide (tm) where teamwork needs to be clumsily reinforced by having insta downs/squishiness that let people pretend they are helping eachother in the most hamfisted design decision of all time.

We are walking super human tankmen fighting bugs, and the intended gameplay experience leaves you scrambling for medicae at all times.

I win every time, but I never once feel cool or strong, and further because I am so limited on HP and ammo my reactions are all on rails.
I ALWAYS have to go for the gun reaction post parry.
I ALWAYS have to go for a cutscene execute to gain armor.
I ALWAYS have burn grenades at swarm pillars cascading up walls.
I ALWAYS pick up and use the 'use here' guns like the flamethrower.
I ALWAYS use my super mode on cooldown to scrounge HP.

I feel like a pathetically weak and clunky man walking through a giant quick time event.

Why did they do this? How is being a paper mache weakling who is forbidden from making gameplay decisions the 'intended experience'?

I want to feel like a space marine.
Unless there are changes, the game fails at what is supposed to make it compelling, though it is undoubtedly beautiful and cool looking.

Прекрасная игра по Вахе

Адская смесь Doom Eternal, Gears и Dark souls

Рекомендую с большой натяжкой для прохождения с друзьями.

У игры есть один большой плюс - половину времени ощущаешь себя в эпицентре блокбастера. Много жирного густого экшена с полчищами врагов. Вау-эффект гарантирован.

А минусов много:

1. Игра раздражает. Одновременно тебе нужно защищать несколько объектов в разных концах базы. Датчики тебе подают сигнал, что нужно прямо сейчас парировать атаки. А тебе не до этого. В эту же секунду оператор нервно орет на тебя, что горгульи повредили антенну. А тебе еще сию секунду нужно очень медленно перезаряжаться, пока тебя жрут жуки. И делать это надо где-то каждые пять секунд.

2. Сразу не понравилась стрельба. Она тут ощущается не так прикольно, как, например, в Destiny, или Hell divers 2. Как-то ничего особенного.

3. Вместо боевого танца - неуклюжая неразбериха. Это если вы, как я, с трудом совмещаете 3d экшен c Dark souls - да, тут регулярно надо кувыркаться и парировать атаки. Как же это надоело...

4. Мультяшность качков-героев можно простить. Но всерьез игру воспринимать сложней.

5. Много невидимых стен.

А еще игра зависает при выходе.

Совершенно проходной сюжет к минусам даже не отношу, он тут для галочки. И уравновешивается в целом качественной графикой.

НИ КОПЕЙКИ НЕ ЖАЛКО!

Основываясь на личных субъективных впечатлений от первых трёх часов игры - АХ*ЕННО! Когда только увидела тизер на TGA, я пищала от восторга, поскольку действительно годных игр по вахе в последнее время крайне мало, а тут нам показали прямо-таки концентрат брутализма, пафоса и мрачности. Всё по заветам Императора. Так вот, решила впервые в жизни раскошелиться на предзаказ самого полного ультра издания. Это влетело мне в копеечку, но какого хрена, один раз живём. И в предвкушении поставила на скачку. А затем поняла, что я наивная дурочка, которая на радостях забыла сравнить системные требования со своим ведром.

- для понимания: видеокарта Nvidia GeForce RTX 2060, процессор Intel Core i5-9400F, RAM - 16 ГБ.

Если видюха ещё вполне справится с минималками, то вот процессор не дотягивает даже до этого. Я уже готова была молиться всем богам, чтобы игра хоть как-то пошла, хоть на каких настройках. С появлением первых отзывов надежд, что она у меня вообще запустится было всё меньше, а когда люди с куда более производительным железом писали, что даже у них игра лагает, тормозит и вылетает - мои шансы и вовсе стремились к нулю. ОДНАКО, я всё же рискнула и запустила. Первый запуск был довольно долгим, и начальный ролик по какой-то причине заглючил и пропустил половину катсцены. Но как только начался геймплей всё нормализовалось. Настройки я выставила средне-низкие и внимательно следила за температурой процессора. К моему удивлению, старичок прекрасно справлялся даже в самых масштабных баталиях, не греясь выше 65-70 градусов и выдавая стабильные 30 FPS. Картинка была достаточно плавная, без фризов и пролагиваний, графика более чем приятная даже на таких настройках. Все последующие кат-сцены шли без огрехов (единственное что в паре мест звук немного отставал от картинки).
Что касается самого геймплея - чистый восторг (ну, лично для меня)! Выбрала сложность Ветеран, чтобы превозмогать, как и положено. И, ожидаемо, мне напихали ещё в прологе по самое небалуйся)) Но стоило привыкнуть ко всем возможным действиям и уже прожимаешь нужные кнопки не задумываясь. Динамика боя просто бомбическая! Сколько раз я выходила из боя победителем с каким-то миллиметров хр, столько же раз я и отхватывала смертельных люлей. Оружие стреляет мощно и сочно, вариантов разных пушек хватает и каждая ощущается вроде похоже, но всё же по-разному. Космодесантник действительно чувствуется тяжеленной машиной смерти даже при простом передвижении, но он всё же не бессмертен и если бездумно кинуться в толпу в надежде затыкать мелкую шушеру цепным мечом - его разорвут за полминуты.
В игре отличное звуковое оформление. Окружение шумит и бахает так, что от звуков выстрела того же тяжёлого болтера (особенно в наушниках) пробегают табуны мурашек по спине. Также удобно ориентироваться на звук готовящейся парируемой и непарируемой атаки, так что даже если в гуще боя ты не видишь противника, то звук даст знать, когда прожать блок/уклонение.
Про визуал даже говорить нечего - полный восторг!
Я слышала про проблемы с сетевой игрой, но уверена, разработчики оперативно всё пофиксят. Игра сделана с огромной любовью ко вселенной и я уверена, что людям, создавшим её далеко не наплевать на свой проект. Поэтому нужно лишь немного подождать и всё разрешится.
Ни разу не жалею за покупку полного предзаказа, ибо занести денюшку на такую шикарнорсть благое дело)
Буду играть дальше, возможно потом дополню отзыв, если вылезут какие-то проблемы или наоборот, поделюсь уже полными впечатлениями. А теперь пойду возносить молитвы Духу Машины моего ПК за то, что он такой молодец))

Апдейт: Окей, есть ложка дёгтя в кастрюле супа. ИИ напарников мог бы быть чуть получше. Приказы им отдавать не получается, как в том же Mass Effect например, врагов не добивают (разве что очень редко), гранаты не кидают (ну или я этого не замечала) и, по факту, они представляют из себя такие передвижные турельки, которые могут слегка отвлечь на себя врага и поднять тебя, если xp обнулится. В целом, на Ветеране даже так проходить норм, челендж есть, но не душный (кроме чёртовых уровней с обороной антенн и цепей), и соответственно эмоциональная отдача от победы в тяжкой битве. Но всё время такое чувство, что ты тупо один всё вывозишь, напарники не ощущаются напарниками. Не сказать, чтоб это как-то сильно портило веселье, но будь они чуть поактивнее, было бы куда бодрее)

Снова апдейт: Хмм, удивительное дело, но как будто с напарниками стало получше, ульты пользуют почаще и даже вроде ставят приоритетом основную цель задания, а не беспорядочное крошево врагов. Видимо, пофиксили.

Ещё один апдейт: Прошла сюжет, градус эпика и пафоса ближе к концу повышался до почти неприличных значений) Да, сюжет прост как две копейки с парочкой небольших вотэтоповоротов, которые знакомым с вахой людьми угадывается на раз. Но в этом есть какое-то своё очарование. Сейчас многие игры и фильмы всё время пытаются завернуть сюжетные тропы в какой-то гибрид морского узла и прошлогодней ёлочной гирлянды, распутывать которые уже просто устаёшь. И вот как же порой не хватает простого и прямолинейного злого зла и доброго добра (не кидайтесь тапками, я в курсе, что в вахе каждая из фракций те ещё ублюдки :). В данном случае тех же тиранидов и бравых космодесантников. Когда ты не терзаешься в сложных душевных метаниях и не плутаешь в серых зонах морали, а просто прёшь напролом с чёткой целью без колебаний стереть с лица галактики всё, что подпадает под определение "зла". Мне очень понравилось и я испытала подлинное удовольствие от игры. Теперь осталось подождать патча на починку сетевого кода и с двух ног врываться в кооператив)

Что хотелось бы ещё от разработчиков, чтобы они где-нибудь в меню добавили кнопку, позволяющую сразу переключиться в оффлайн режим. Поскольку у меня при прохождении сюжета при переходе в новый сегмент главы порой терялась связь с сервером и даже когда я нажимала продолжить оффлайн, меня отбрасывало на приличный кусок главы назад и приходилось перепроходить (так было примерно 2 раза за игру, в остальных случаях потери соединения игра спокойно шла дальше, только в оффлайн режиме).

Having just finished the game i am of two minds about it:

The Good: It builds on the first game and does a great job of making you feel like a space marine. Your powerful and hit like a truck, it is friendly to the lore and brings the world of 40k to life. I have seen some reviews talking about the first half of the game being the worst part and i have to disagree. The first half of the game defending worlds from tyranids is amazing and exciting. Watching a whole swarm descend on a guarded position as you, your brothers and the scared guardsmen hold the line is great.

And now here is where the bad comes in:

The second half of the game feels like a rehash of the first game. It feels like they just wanted to have you fight chaos for pretty much no reason other than you did it in the first game. This is a issue as it left me wanting more, you just seemingly wipe the nids and chase chaos and to me this was boring. When they showed there would be three worlds to fight on i was expecting a long story where i am jumping from world to world dealing with its attackers and i feel this is what saber should have done. It should have been you fighting the nids on one world whilst chaos attacks another and a 3rd faction the other and then have them merge. But instead its simply hey you seemingly dealt with the nids now go fight chaos for the last act.

Overall i recommend it if you are a fan of 40k or the first game as it does fill the need of 40k fun and that fun from the first game. Just dont expect it to fill you at the current moment roughly 2 days of playing and i have finished the story on veteran i expected more saber. Hopefully a DLC will come out with more missions

This game is great. The Atmosphere, how well it does at immersing you into the story as you fight hordes of Tyranids - OR take the fight into the eternal battle to destroy the heretics.

The game style takes some time to get used to, if you're not accustomed to playing this style of game. There are definitely some problems with it at launch, but what game doesn't have problems at launch now a days.

The PvP is fun, and I can see it growing as they continue to release content with the game. The PvE is fantastic, and I look forward to seeing where the devs take it.

This isn’t just a game; it’s a pilgrimage into the grimdark glory of Warhammer 40K, where every bolter shot sings praises to the Emperor and every Tyranid screams in regret for ever invading the galaxy. You don’t play as a Space Marine — you ascend to one, crushing heretics and xenos alike with the elegance of a chainsword tearing through alien flesh.

The setting? A masterpiece of gothic despair, where every ruin and skull (so many skulls!) reminds you that the galaxy hates you — and you're here to hate it right back. Tyranids swarm like they own the place (spoiler: they don’t), and Chaos whispers temptations you answer with righteous ultraviolence.

Graphics? So good it’s practically a heretical experience. My PC now has a Machine Spirit that groans every time I boot it up. Gameplay? It’s like the Codex Astartes came to life and gave you a chainsword, saying, “Go forth and do the Emperor’s work.”

Flaws? Just one: I can’t shout FOR THE EMPEROR loud enough to match the carnage on-screen. But that’s not the game’s fault — that’s on me.

If you’ve ever wanted to stand against an endless swarm of Tyranids, crack their chitinous skulls, and tell Chaos where it can shove its warp nonsense, this is your moment.

10/10 — would purge xenos and heretics again. The Emperor approves.
THE EMPEROR PROTECTS!

黃金版能早4天遊玩，但感覺上遊戲伺服器已經受不住壓力
人少時 loading 時間15秒，人多時段入伺服器需要5分鐘
不敢想像9 號正式推出後會出現怎樣的災情

遊戲本身好玩，不論是兵種特色還是技能、專長都有一定吸引力
然而推進主線故事沒有任何獎勵、不能選擇兵種
和朋友一起打主線也不能一起解鎖關卡，能解鎖的只有場主
變相要玩家自己推一次主線
令人沒有想要打故事模式的慾望

另外就是內容、關卡偏少
聯機戰鬥只有6個任務關卡
遊戲本身卻需要農很多東西：職業等級、武器等級、武器升級素材之類
6個關卡真的體感太少

PVP感覺根本只是硬塞進來的東西
可有可無，制作組還不如把時間花去加強單機跟合作內容
就算沒劇情再多給兩張地圖都比較好

平衡方向有待改進
同類武器也有幾種選擇，但好用的少之又少
堪用的也不多，垃圾槍一堆 (也算是遊戲通病?)
關卡難度提升只是無腦把怪物的數量血量跟攻擊力堆起來，每級難度感覺提血20%
槍械升級要用的素材要打高難關卡，但未升級的槍跑去打高難就異常痛苦
就算是升級了的槍，武器的數值還追不上敵人血量的成長速度
如果說每級難度提血敵人20%血量和攻擊力，那每級武器只有提升10%
拿未升級的槍打普通難度關卡，比拿已升級的槍打高難關卡 要輕鬆很多

遊戲值得入手
但貌似不需要在遊戲推出時立即入手

The core game here is great. The enemy variety leaves a little to be desired, interface slightly clunky, and the side missions are (so far) inconsistent.

I am starting to hate the way they've tied health and armor systems into melee. Especially on higher difficulties it's just not feasible to regain health in certain fights.

Additionally the TE-style red/blue rings for dodges and parrys ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ suck. It feels like a duck tape solution to their wanting to implement dark souls-esque timing requiments while filling the screen with swarms of enemies. It becomes and annoying indecipherable mess.

Oh and the ammo replenishment mechanics do not work in boss fights that physically yank your camera away to LOOK AT BIRD when your trying to replenish ammo.

Good 40k game, but there's a lot of jank getting in the way of a great overall experience.

7/10

The latest 40k game that got tons of positive reviews before it was even released. It tells the story of how three and a half ultramarines defeated just a few million tyrranids and chaos followers. Again attached lobotomized psyker, chaos-thermo-lord-wizard, references to Lord of the Rings and, unlike the first part, not fapable IG girl.
This game, apparently, enough money, so we have:
The scenery in the game is exactly three kinds again: ruins in swamps, city, cemetery in the ruins. The only glimmer of light at the very end: the ruins of cemetery in a warp anomaly.
Enemies are also of three types: tyranids, chaosites, and demon. Though for each type are drawn special, pathos-busting animations of knocking out heresy.
Weapons compared to the tabletop redesigned just to the point of impossibility: from melta made shotgun, from laska sniper, from stormbolter dull machine gun, and from the jumping satchel evil machine unstoppable imba. And they didn't let me dabble in heavy weapons

1)The game presents genetically enhanced superhuman warriors as ordinary overgrown men in sealed lats.
2)Almost the entire game, while in the combat zone, the protagonists walk around without helmets (Strictly forbidden by the Codex Astartes). The phrase of the captain (!) of the Ultramarines (!!!) addressed to the sergeant “Why do you take the Codex Astartes so seriously?” is tantamount to breaking the oath of some Creed regiment.
3)The aforementioned captain, fighting with weapons the average SM would be ashamed of, in armor less flashy than the sergeant next to him.
4)Royals in bushes the size of a necron tomb.

However, in general, game came out not bad and even much more lore-friendly than 3rd DoW
--------------------------------------
Последняя игрушка по 40к, получившая кучу положительных оценок ещё до выхода. Повествует о том, как три с половиной ультрамарина победили всего-то несколько миллионов тирранидов и хаоситов. Опять прилагается лоботомированный псайкер, хаос-термо-лорд-волшебник, отсылки к Властелину Колец и, в отличии от первой части, не фапабельная ИГшница. Тем не менее, бабло на игру, видимо, хватило, в отличии от первой части, благодаря чему:

Декораций в игре ровно опять три вида: руины в болотах, город, кладбище в руинах. Единственный проблеск света в самом конце: руины кладбища в варп-аномалии.
Врагов тоже три вида: тираниды, хаоситы, демон. Хотя для каждого типа прорисованы особые, пафосные анимации вышибания ереси.
Оружие по сравнению с настолкой переработано просто донельзя: из мелты сделали дробовик, из лазки снайперку, из штормболтера унылый пулемет, а из прыжкового ранца злобную машину неостановимой имбы. И не дали побаловаться тяжелым оружием

Игра преподносит генетически улучшенных воинов-сверхлюдей, как обычных мужиков-переростков в герметичных латах.
Практически всю игру, находясь в зоне боевых действий, главные герои ходят без шлемов (Строжайше запрещено Кодексом Астартес). Фраза капитана (!) Ультрамаринов (!!!), обращённая к сержанту «А чего ты так серьёзно относишься к Кодексу Астартес?» равносильна нарушению присяги каким-нибудь кридским полком.
Упомянутый капитан, воюющий с оружием, которого постыдился бы и обычный десантник, в доспехе менее пафосном чем у сержанта рядом.
Рояли в кустах размером с упомянутый титан.
Впрочем, в целом игрушка вышла неплохая и даже куда более бэковая, чем ДоВ 3.

It's pretty good, definitely not perfect as it comes with some flaws but it's a well done sequel to the first game.

Visuals
Game's visual aspect looks great, especially considering the absolute chaos you see happening on the screen with so many enemies swarming and things blowing up, with even small attention to detail existing such as the fact you get mud stains on your armour (and blood ofc) as you go through some of the marshy parts of the planet, it looks damn good but due to performance being somewhat shoddy, up scaling is needed which softens the image so people who can't stand temporal softness to an image will not be happy

Optimizaiton








I played through it solo on Veteran, my initial experience was a bit Luke-warm with the first few missions but it didn't take long for me to get more into it, especially since the campaign gets better as you progress it, early missions have this more frequent re-occurring issue that is present when you're playing solo, where certain segments feel like they're not meant for you to be on your own with the two AI partners that share a singular brain cell, such as for an example having to use a flame thrower to push back a swarm of tiny lil' insects whilst dealing with lots of ranged enemies and having to complete some objectives, problem is, the flamer takes you primary weapon away so all you're down to is your pistol for ranged enemies plus enemies in solo mode tend to focus more on the solo player than the two AI partners, so these situations can feel a bit bad . However , this starts becoming less so of a problem at the mid point of the campaign where it starts feeling like they put some more thought into making it more enjoyable when playing solo. The campaign as a whole is really damn good by the end, apart from some stumbles in design where it can very much feel like it's a Co-Op campaign with an optional solo mode from time to time, it's epic, doesn't over stay its welcome , ends on a pretty satisfying note with a spectacular final act fight that was incredibly kick a**.

Merci, enfin un vrai jeu vidéo !

Всем привет. Я люблю Warhammer 40000, любимая вселенная. Эта игра бомбическая, мясо, кишки пиломеч, болтеры, пафос и космодесант с вечной войной присутсвуют в обалденном исполнении. Минусы: Движок дерьмово работает с разными видеокартами, текстуры противников могут прорисовываться минутами или не рисоваться вообще, графику приходится сильно шакалить, что бы просто модельки были на экране. У меня не последнее железо 3050 Ti, но и не самая плохая видеокарта и по системкам проходит, игра не соответствует заявленным требованиям. Мы на ПК конечно шаманы, но неужели нельзя было оттестировать на разном железе, дабы игроки могли насладится этим пафосом по полной. Обзор буду редактировать по мере улучшения продукта, сегодня 08.09.2024, день до релиза. Император защищает!( но хмур и недоволен)
После патча поправили исчезание врагов, стало менше мыла и в принципе стала лучше стабильность. Буду еще испытывать, но уже могу советовать. Все умники считающие себя гуру железа могут пройти в направлении сервиторизации, сольётесь с ним воедино.

You can draw a straight line between World War Z and this game. If anything, it leaves you wanting more. More maps, more enemy types, more everything. Nothing here overstays its welcome, and though the character writing is flat, it takes an already great formula from their last licensed game and faithfully applies a new license with a lot of attention to detail.

It may need some optimization to play better on Steam Deck and older systems, and if the prior game is anything to go on, the monetization will be light.

One of the few games worth full price in awhile IMO. If the game had another month or two in the oven I feel it would have been next to perfect at launch bug wise. Balancing of weapons needs some work currently, but that's an easy fix. Just please don't go the helldivers route and nerf everything that is decent.

Best way I can describe the game is "Refreshing".

整个游戏，除开剧情以外，就是一整坨的狗屎。
强制在线这个问题都算了，服务器辣鸡的一批，搞笑的是单人剧情居然还要强制保持联网，断线后直接给我读档到上一个存档点，甚至我都离线了，加载时还要尝试加入服务器，是不是脑瘫。
行动模式离线玩了也是白打，线上进度不同步。
游戏优化也是垃圾得不得了，4090+78x3d，帧数只有90-130帧平均，1%lOW低得时候甚至只有50。游戏动不动就卡顿一下，跑着路莫名其妙有时候也会突然卡顿一下，切屏的话更是必然卡顿。
PVE行动模式下，爆弹数值臭不可闻，基本上全是玩具枪刮痧，纯垃圾玩意，看着还不如手电筒。并且多少因为WWZ还想着会不会爆弹多少会有一点点穿透或是爆炸伤害，结果毛都没有，跟普通得子弹没啥区别。
星际战士在游戏中得表现也是属于败完官方各种设定，为了平衡性，整个角色慢吞吞得，格挡反击打空还有着很长得延迟和硬直，只有手枪爆头还算是动作迅速，但是一大堆其他作会导致爆头判定延迟很长时间，左键按烂了也都触发不了

总体来说就是一个垃圾。

На данный момент 6часов только в сюжетной компании игры.
При чём играла на пару с знакомым всё время после пролога.
Но даже игра в компании не спасла игру...
Обзор обновлю по мере освоения контента, а пока:
1) боевая система даже из того что заявлено крайне мало вариативности и контента имеет число огнестрела/комбо атак,
А к этому прибавьте то что из 5ти автоматом отличий нет ДЕ ФАКТО никаких.
Так же как и комбо не ощущаются как то по особому полное ощущение что кроме как пкм/пкм/пкм ничего и не нужно.
И "узлов" которые должны формировать ядро разнообразия мало, и того что есть по факту ещё меньше ибо смысла не имеет даже чисто из "хочу" не ощущается просто автомат 2 отличным от автомата 1 или автомата 3, ну нету отличий в ощущениях.
В прологе игра вас учит парировать и уклонятся а так же добивающим выстрелам соло цели, но тут же игра будет забрасывать толпами кидая всех врагов на вас без разбору не пытаясь в 88%ов случаев создавать из разных типов врагов и проектировки локаций интересные ситуации, запомнилась только локация где мы прятаясь за разрушаемыми статуями отстреливались от снайперов, это единственная интересная ситуация была на 6часов сюжетки (не прошли а наиграли)
типов врагов только 5 и 2 босса и так 5 часов до появления хаоситов, которые по сути рескины единственное отличие хаоситов то что большие мобы хаоса (космодесант хаоса) умеют телепортироваться, в остальном они идентичны своим аналогам у тиранидов.
В итоге миссии это череда 1нообразной каши из 5и типов врагов иногда появляются 1 из 2ух боссов всё.

Перечислять мелочи касательно недостатков боевой системы можно ещё долго не хватит символов обзора.

2) сюжета словно бы нет, тита не развивают, все персонажи помимо тита пустышки ни характера ни личности, никаких интересных диалогов или катсцен, химии между рядовым и титом в 1ой части когда они спорили на тему кодекса Астартес больше чем химии между титом и всеми персонажами 2ки вместе взятыми, и это не гипербола, просто в этой сцене в 1 химия была был конфликт который закладывал основу сюжета, а в 2ки просто нету ни сюжета ни диалогов ни какого то интереса к повествованию, драматургия не знакома разработчикам игры от слова совсем.
Даже когда были моменты когда ожидаешь максимально логичных тропов в рамках ситуации, их не было.
Такое ощущение что весь сюжет написала и срежиссировала нейросеть, и ещё раз ЭТО НЕ ГИПЕРБОЛА, это 1 в 1 так.

3) оптимизация у меня железо выше рекомендованных, я не сталкаш я не графодр()очер я поставила на низкие всю графику. у меня 2070super/i5 9600/16ram 3200. И при этом у меня фпс стабильно скачет от 40 до 60ти, и я понимаю те сцены где большая локация куча врагов и союзников, но почему в коридорных локациях падает фпс? на низких.
НИЗКИХ, моё железо 4 года назад было предтоповым считай особенно видяха, а тут игра которая ничем не выделяется на низких так падает в фпс, а местами фпс падал до 16цати, боюсь представить что будет за слайд шоу на минимальных указанных требованиях.

У меня есть ещё очень много что сказать но не поместиться в отзыв всё но основные претензии озвучила.

Если вы далеки от вахи и вам пофигу на канон, для вас это просто казуальная плохенькая игра с малой вариативностью и зевотным сюжетом.

Если вы довераст 20цатилетней выдержки как и я, кто имеет хотя бы 200часов подкастов прослушанных и чтения вики/кодексов, вам будет больно от бреда по бэку.

А если вы настольшик эксперт бэка, поберегите сердце, боюсь представить как больно будет вам.

НЕ покупайте игру за полный ценник, вы ничего не упускаете не поиграв в неё, эту игру брать меньше чем за 75%ов скидки не стоит, хотя даже так она не стоит денег, лучше переходите на импортозамещение.

А я продолжу играть ради создания видео обзора, буду страдать за вас... памагите Q...Q

Blue man group but cool

Solid enough game - it does what it says on the tin - be a giant super human and smack bugs around. Story seems fun so far, operations are good (but with a caveat) and I like the melee and gunplay. After some more time in the game (both story and operation) I can delve a bit deeper into things.

Story - 7/10. It's pretty straight forward, though there might be a twist or turn in there (that I'm sure you have already gotten spoiled through various news media anyway). Not much to say. Simple, but cool.

World building - 10/10. Top marks. The maps, the battlefields, the chaos, the swarms, the absolute gore - it's just fantastic. It's beautiful and disturbing and just beyond anything I expected. Game teaches you about the 40k world and the immersion it provides gets you really stuck into it making you want to know more.

Gameplay - 9/10. Gameplay is marvelous. Though I'm still struggling with the timing of dodges and parries I've occasionally gotten in a flow where I just become a blender, chopping xeno scum to the left, doding xeno scum to the right, and firing of headshots as quick reaction. I for sure need to get better at the combat flow, but I can easily see how good it can be if you get good at it and once you do it's going to be euphoric.

Operations - 8/10, but with a caveat. The mainstay of the game in my opinion. It has huge potential and even the little I've played is so much fun. It reminds me of the golden days of Mass Effect 3 multiplayer (if you know, you know). However the biggest issue is playing without a full team - because you are stuck trying to connect with random players and that is it's own bag of worm. From people with bad connection, to people who won't go to the mission area, to people who just afk. I honestly prefer having bots over the random players, but unfortunately you can't choose to add bots - you have to hope nobody tries to join. The fact that we can't add bots makes me want to subtract 2 points from the score on it's own because the issues with random players can be very aggravating. They need to add an option to add bots..

Endless War - haven't played =p Might try it some day, but not a big PvP so - check others opinion on this game mode.

Would I recommend? I think, yes. If you enjoy the concept of loop gameplay from operations, and you have a full team (or the devs add option to add bots) I think you will have a blast. I know I will once I'm done with the random player issues.

Oh, and a final note. Stay away from the ultimate edition and cosmetic DLC's and all that. Even if you pay for it you still have to unlock it. So you buy for the right to unlock the cosmetics, but you still have to spend requisition on it which takes super long to grind. My biggest regret is paying for the "cosmetic options" I don't have enough points to unlock lol.

A visceral, simple Warhammer 40,000 experience that is presented as a simple game you can just pick up and play, albeit knowing at least a bit of the story of the first game is very helpful.

Combat has weight and impact to it, the marines look good, the tyranids are relentless and the corridors and areas feel atmospheric. I mainly have small complaints like that bolters could have a little more punch to their sounds, blocking being a little confusing at the beginning and the menus being annoying to navigate with a controller as the cursor slows down A LOT on some UI elements but it sure does feel good to just have a game you can just play for fun without much modern nonsense in the way of just playing it. I'm also enjoying the photo mode.

I do have one big complaint already which is that while playing the campaign alone I almost lost one fight due to lag. Felt really odd and kind of sad that otherwise such an awesome fight was rubberbanding severely.

This game is certainly not heresy for the license. FOR THE EMPEROR!

I never expected a sequel to one of my guilty pleasure games but I'm so happy it exists! This game is such a huge improvement to the first one. The story was so fun and soooo sick. The addition of easy drop-in, drop-out for co-op was fantastic. Visuals were wayyy better than I expected and might be one of the nicest looking games I've ever played (at the time of this writing? lmao).
The only gripe I have is with the lack of information presented for pvp. It took quite a while to get into my first match and I had no idea if I was actually gonna get in since it gave me no indication besides "Waiting for other Battle Brothers" in a full lobby. Turns out I was waiting for the match that I joined to end... I think. It would also be nice to have one sentence explaining each of the pvp modes. Switching armor parts instead of choosing a chapter was also confusing.
Other than that, I loved playing through the story, can't wait to get the squad together for Operations, and I'm super happy this game exists!
