Space Marine 2 is well set in the grimdark universe of Warhammer 40K. As a continuation of the OG Space Marine Game from 2011, it attempts to bring the one-decade old formula of bolter shooting and chainsawsword slashing to 2024. However, it struggles to do so and is very expensive on top. I really enjoy playing the game and will most likely cotinue to play it. But it has some notable flaws and if you are thinking about buying the game you should consider the following.


If you're a fan of Warhammer 40k and a sucker for the (totally not overrepresented) Ultra Marines, its a awesome implementation in the Universe.
The game is a well representation (even if a little generalized) of the lore and atmosphere that makes up the core of 40k for me. It allows you to stomp Tyranids and match yourself with . In the Coop PVE and the PVP mode, the Customization System allows you to tailor your Character into your favorite Space Marine Chapter or Chaos Legion. The Lovecraftian horrors of the 40k universe are well-represented, making the story engaging despite its somewhat bleak plot and dialogue.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------

However, if you're not deeply invested in the 40k Universe, Space Marine 2 falls short. The gameplay feels outdated, with clunky mechanics that haven't evolved much since the original game . Combat can be fun, but it's often repetitive and lacks the refinement seen in other smilar modern titles. The writing is another weak point, with dialogue that ranges from uninspired to outright poor. Online multiplayer is plagued by long wait times, frequent connection errors, and bugs that, for example, can make enemies invisible (very fun), breaking immersion and gameplay. The game has a very hard time to offer anything beyond its niche appeal, making its steep tag hard to justify for newcomers to the world of 40K aswell as casual players.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------


Space Marine 2 delivers exactly what I want out of a Warhammer 40k game: a grimdark experience in a universe that lacks hope with the permanent thread of extinction for a human race lost in endless external and internal conflict. However, it struggles to appeal beyond its core audience due to outdated gameplay, technical issues, and blunt writing. If you're a diehard fan of 40k, you'll find enjoyment in this game despite its flaws. For everyone else, who just want to stomp some Aliens and blow up stuff, there are better and less expensive options.

Dans une assiette creuse, déposez une demi-banane que vous réduisez en purée avec une fourchette. Si vous n’êtes pas un grand adepte de la saveur de la banane dans vos desserts, vous pouvez sauter cette étape, cela n’impactera pas la qualité de vos brioches.

Versez par-dessus les 120 g de yaourt grec, la farine, la levure et l’extrait de vanille. Si vos pépites de chocolat sont déjà préparées, versez-les également.

Sinon, coupez votre tablette en morceau à la main puis à l’aide d’un hachoir ou d’un gros couteau, réduisez-les en pépites. Plus celles-ci seront grosses, plus vous obtiendrez des morceaux de chocolat fondant dans vos brioches au moment de la cuisson.

Ajoutez-les ensuite à la préparation et mélangez le tout. Pétrissez la pâte obtenue dans vos mains et divisez-la ensuite en 4 petites boules.

Déposez ces boules sur une plaque allant au four recouverte de papier sulfurisé. Badigeonnez-les de jaune d’œuf à l’aide d’un pinceau.

Puis réalisez une petite entaille sur le dessus de chaque brioche pour une meilleure cuisson.

Placez-les enfin au four chaud (180°C) pendant 15 à 20 minutes. Surveillez la cuisson, l’objectif est qu’elles soient bien dorées !

Странная игра. И хорошая и плохая одновременно.

Отличительная черта любой игры для меня это геймплей и он здесь ниже среднего. Может быть потому что я играл на норме мне так показалось. Благо игра проходится за 10 часов максимум. Под конец, конечно, разгоняешься и ты уже по-ветерански быстро нажимаешь на квитайм нападки ксеносов и хаоситов, даже начинает нравится.

Но хотелось бы глубины: уникальные добивания, скиллы, пассивки, даже задания по типу убейте с боевого ножа 200 противников были бы в тему - всё таки 2024 год на дворе. А как многие заметили игра сделана по инструкциям 2010 года.

А вот что собственно хорошее в игре так это крутейшая постановка. Катсцены и ролики на должном уровне. История незатейлива и проста, но в тоже время способна увлечь.

Срежессировано так что погружаешься прям. Хочется орать в битве "Во имя Императора!", когда идешь вместе с астра милитарум в бой. С братьми журить адептус механикус за чванство.

Компаньоны - прописанные герои, а не болванчики, что радует. Прикипаешь к ним даже.

Сюжет моё почтение и старикам угодили, продолжив старую конву про артефакт. И с фанбазой заигрывают показывая тиранидов, боевую технику империума, хаоситов, некронские руины. И новичкам тоже вроде должно быть более менее понятно о чём речь. База - одним словом.

Мультик, ну он есть. А зачем? Ну тем кому недостаточно вахи в жизни, наверное.

В итоге: БРУТАЛЬНО, КРОВАВО, ЭПИЧНО. Рекомендую, но денег жалко. Не стоит она данной суммы, но когда видишь в титрах сплошь русские фамилии и cumis enjoer`а - уже и не жалко вроде. Говорю же: странно.
联机系统有点问题，服务器太烂了
For Glory, for the Emperor!!!

This is by far my GOTY contender for 2024. I will not argue with people who don't agree for stupid reasons. The story is so stupidly incredible and epic. It fits perfectly for a Warhammer 40k game. The gameplay can at times be a little yanky and rough but is for the most part perfectly great and fun. Ripping a tyranid open from the middle and being drenched in its blood never gets old.

The operations game mode is so much fun, playing as my own space marine completing missions really is amazing. Even replaying the same missions doesn't get old.

The pvp game mode is the best pvp in any game I have ever played. I never liked playing pvp until I tried it in this game. However it is a bit unbalanced as some classes are absolute dogsh*t in pvp. Or at least on some gamemodes. I'm sure it will improve.

The customization is incredible, all that I am missing is more customization for heretic factions, which I don't doubt will come later considering how many people want it.

The only complaints for this game I have seen are: No widescreen support (Which will come to the game in september, just check the roadmap) , Oh I don't wanna connect to epic games services (Doesn't make the game bad, and is only there so you can play crossplay), The AI companions are so bad that I can't play the campaign solo (Literally a skill issue???)
This is finally a game that is not pay to win and it is clear that the devs reallly care about the game. In my eyes this game is joining baldurs gate 3 for being an actually good game in modern times. Yes some cosmetics will cost money, but all other content coming to the game is free. So people need to stop complaining about this game, because it is simply breathtaking.

In summary, this game is worth every penny. I bought Ultra Edition instead of Gold Edition even if it only gives me a cool cosmetic for Ultramarines (and I really dislike ultramarines) but I still don't regret it. I would have bought this game if it cost $150 base edition. Good that it doesn't but still, It is worth the money to me personally. Now keep in mind, I love warhammer 40k and have done for a while so I am a bit biased. But for a Warhammer 40k fan, this game is like the game of my dreams. SO WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR!? BUY IT NOW! AND MARCH FOR THE EMPEROR!!!

Эта пве игра - живой пример, показывающий, что крупные студии могут делать классные и красивые игры, если готовы вложить в нее душу. Несмотря на то, что я играл до релиза и патча первого дня, багов практически не было, а те, что были - были крайне несущественны и не мешали погружению в игру.

Если вам нравится атмосфера вселенной вархаммера 40.000, то эта игра - ваш выбор, но вот цена... Цена и вправду великовата. Особенно на специальные издания, которые по сути являются просто сизон пассами и скинчиками. Но если вы хотите поддержать создание крупных сюжетных игр, то лучше поддержите разработчиков.

TLDR: Game is very good, GOTY for me.

As an enjoyer of 40k its nice to be eating good again.

This is a masterpiece, I haven't played a game that has made me this happy in a long time. The gameplay, the lore, the graphics, all of it sings of love and care. This game has so many little details that have made me and my friends stop and appreciated them (not mentioning which in order to avoid spoiling).

The gameplay is visceral and responsive, simple to pick up but with some dept to it.
The lore, according to my more learned friends as I am but a novice in the 40k ways, is very good, and they took great care with some details.
And the graphics are beautiful, the contrast between the amazing visceral displays in combat and the beautiful but war thorn landscape around is amazing.

This topped off with non-predatory monetisation, only cosmetics can be bought, and even then there are plenty to earn in game, the future updates are free and will bring so many wonderful things is such a breath of fresh air.

I know some people had a couple of bugs, and I too experienced some, nothing game breaking, but some crashes and some goofy physics in cutscenes. I am hoping today's patch addressed that for new players.

Courage and Honour!

Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2 – очень старомодно сделанная линейная игра, где есть сюжетная кампания-аттракцион на 10 часов, отдельный мультиплеер и кооперативный режим. Главное — разработчикам удалось правильно передать атмосферу Warhammer 40,000. Брутальные битвы, монументальные сооружения и давящая мрачная атмосфера с пафосными разговорами о братстве и вере. Всё это в концентрированном виде постоянно присутствует на экране. Не менее важно и то, что авторам удалось совместить механики стрельбы и ближнего боя, а также спроектировать боевые ситуации так, что игра не теряет ощущения свежести до самого финала. Эту игру очень сложно оценивать как-то иначе, кроме как "Это самый настоящий Warhammer".

结论：中规中矩的战锤40k第三人称射击游戏，没有什么非常出彩的地方。但是玩起来还不错。从没关的挑战上看，Darktide还是对各种数据有着更多的研究，这一代更像是个普通砍砍游戏，没有太多的配合和技能讲究。画面不错，音乐也不错，气氛也不错。目前不支持宽屏，根据roadmap九月份就加入超宽屏支持。皮肤是一堆，喜欢战锤的倒也不是很亏。各项升级都是体现了肝的样子，看起来需要刷很久。

最后吐槽：本人最讨厌Primaris，GW就是喜欢强推自己的棋子。我就是标准30k玩家。为了不吃书，开始往30k里填情节，填故事。Siege of terra系列里的Sons of the selenar就加入了这个狗屁primaris的基因种子，好好好。primaris配U团，真是摆明了的营销棋子策略。最讨厌马桶盖战团，最讨厌primaris，两者兼具，负负得正。但是我变得更恶心了。Horus看着都要吐了，Fulgrim的JJ也要吐了，Magnus脑袋爆浆，Mortarion浑身上下涌出了白色的液体，Angron因为太恶心所以打算砍掉自己的脑袋然后吃了它。就这样，非常恶心。

Emperor would be proud of this dev team.

Game is great and super fun - any 40k fans will be happy.

เขียนบทวิจารณ์ เมื่อวันที่: 09/09/2024
จากประสบการณ์ที่เริ่มเล่นตั้งแต่ Day 1 **แบบเข้าถึงล่วงหน้า**
นี่คือเกมแอ็คชัน ผจญภัย สวมบทบาทที่ดีที่สุด ใน ณ. ตอนนี้ หากพูดถึงข้อดีและข้อเสียของเกมนี้:

ข้อดี
- ระบบกราฟิก: เข้าขั้น "ประทับใจแบบไม่ผิดหวังเลย"
เนื่องจาก ได้ติดตามตั้งแต่ข่าวการประกาศเกมนี้ รวมไปถึง การโฆษณาระบบเกมเพลย์แบบ Demo
นี่คือ **เกมในชีวิตของผมเกมแรก** ที่รู้สึกว่า ไม่มีการดาวน์เกรดใดๆทั้งสิ้น
"Demo มายังไง!! เกมจริงก็มาแบบนั้น!!"

- ระบบเนื้อเรื่อง: มีความ Hype อย่างมาก
ทีมงานทำระบบดังกล่าว ในสเกลที่ใหญ่มาก ทำให้ผู้เล่นรู้สึก มีอารมณ์ร่วมไปกับเกมได้อย่างไม่ยากเย็น

โหด มันส์ ครบทุกรูปแบบ
ทางทีมงาน ทำการบ้านมาดีมากๆ ด้วยรูปแบบ และธีมของจักรวาลนี้ จึงมาครบหมด


ไม่ผิดหวังแน่นอน มีความฉลาด และท้าทาย
ด้วยความที่เป็นทีมงานเดียวกันกับ Crysis 2, Killing Floor 2 และ
เห็นชื่อก็รู้เลย

แต่งจนเพลิน ไม่มีที่ติ
มีความหลากหลายเป็นอย่างมาก ถ้าใครที่เป็นแฟนจักรวาลนี้อยู่แล้ว บอกเลยว่า "ฟินแบบ*2"

เหมือนกำลังดูหนัง ที่เราควบคุมตัวละครได้
"เสียงปืน และกระสุนที่พุ่งใส่ร่างศัตรู", "เสียงดาบที่เฉียนเนื้อศัตรู", "เสียงกระฉากเนื้อออกเป็นชิ้นๆ"
รวมไปถึง เสียงพากย์ของตัวละครที่มีอารมณ์ร่วมไปกับเหตุการณ์
ทุกอย่างนี้

เกมนี้ มีระบบบรรยายไทย ไม่ต้องห่วงเรื่อง การแปลภาษา ตามทันได้ทุกสถานการณ์

:
ถึงแม้ว่า จักรวาลของเกมนี้ มีความยิ่งใหญ่มากกว่า Helldivers 2 แน่นอน
แต่ระบบเนื้อเรื่องเกมนี้ ที่ย้ำว่า ยังคงมีการประทะกัน แค่เผ่า Tyranids ส่วนใหญ่
ในทางกลับกัน Helldivers 2



เมื่อเล่นเป็นเวลานาน จะเริ่มรู้สึกเบื่อ เพราะภารกิจยังคงไม่หลากหลายพอ
(ขึ้นอยู่กับผู้เล่นแต่ละคน และรอการอัพเดทต่อไป )

มีเพียงเล็กน้อยมากๆ เช่น การสปอนศัตรูอัดหน้า เป็นต้น
(แต่ถือว่ามีน้อยมากๆ ใน Day 1 หากเปรียบเทียบกับเกมอื่นๆ)

มีการแปลที่ดี แต่ยังไม่ดีเยี่ยม มีการใช้คำบางคำ ที่ไม่ตรงต่อสถานการณ์
เช่น ศัพท์ทางการทหาร, ยุทธวิธี, รูปประโยค หรือสำนวนที่ควรจะเป็น เป็นต้น
(ขอชื่นชมทีมงานเป็นอย่างสูง และหวังว่า คอนเมนต์นี้ จะเป็นประโยชน์ต่อทีมงานในการพัฒนาต่อไป)

- หากจะเล่นเกมนี้: ย้ำว่า ตาม System Requirements จริงๆ
(ประสบการณ์ส่วนตัว คือ เปิดแล้ว เนื้อเรื่องค้าง จอดำ เกมดับ ครบเลย)

在已经2024年的今天，战锤这一IP也快和整电子游戏历史一样度过了几十年，在这个过程中也曾诞生了不少战锤系列的各类型游戏，比如战锤全面战争、末日鼠疫、暗潮等等。而本次的星际战士2作为标准游戏工业的水平展现，也为战锤系列游戏立下了又一个重大工具点。不得不说战锤这一IP是非常幸运的，先不论暗潮与星际战士2后续运营如何，单说游戏总体质量确实很高，隔壁的士官长与战争机器可谓是馋哭了。



本次星际战士2分为3个模式，战役模式玩家扮演泰图斯小队在8日战争中结束敌人的阴谋，而行动模式玩家可以自定义星际战士扮演战役中与泰图斯小队互相接应的小队执行同一战役的不同任务，该模式有职业与武器rpg系统，也承担了游戏中刷刷刷的要素。最后一个是没有数值成长的PVP模式，内置等级仅用来解锁武器使用权限。



本作的整体设计其实非常的传统，3个模式完全分开，各司其职，战役专注与给玩家带来一段近些年十分少见的猛男冒险故事，序章讲述主角从哪里来又准备做什么，结果遭遇意外而进入本篇的故事中去，成为一个小队长，有两位不那么听话的队友，在大事件中先执行各种较小的任务徐徐展开这个世界，有着十分传统的关卡设计，同时每一关都塞入一些当今游戏愈加少见的大场景与多演出脚本。在这个过程中慢慢展示主角与队友的羁绊，最终面对大危机展开决战。这也是老ass游戏的一个特点，就算在游玩前流程被剧透，但当自己真正游玩，看到，听到这些事、这些人物、这些大规模场景在面前发生时仍会感到兴奋与颤栗。



同时在战役中有很多战锤这个系列的经典演绎，熟悉该ip的玩家恐怕还没开始就已经能想象到故事的发展方向，但对于未曾接触过战锤的路人而言该作的剧情也是非常简单直接，前因后果交代的十分清除，没有什么需要额外买小说、漫画才能看懂剧情的谜语人设计，没有太大的理解成本，对外人可谓是十分友好。而对于锤佬而言游戏处处都是细节，比如流程中一段星界军众人抬不起来的大门被星际战士一人抬起，就会让锤佬会心一笑，且这段演出在其他玩家也能简单看出主角的强大。



还有各种经典战锤环节，如旗插兄贵山更有经典剧情：基因原体中十三阿哥基里曼麾下极限军团战团长、胶瘾上头的ICU战神、那个蓝人、全银河最难杀的男人、抱着太空死灵家的电线杆做武器、干爆泰伦巢主、一拳打死战神化身、两拳打爆安哥拉斯狗肉、两颗心脏成为混沌打卡圣地的超级猛男——卡尔加！（和他的担架小队）堂堂登场！堂堂单挑！




游戏本身的打击感与操控感也非常顶级，让玩家真正觉得我们所操控的是个3米高的超级兄贵，无论是因为庞大盔甲导致的走路姿势还是各种近战武器打在泰伦虫族身上都能让玩家感受我们这三十万匹马力的拳头究竟有多强大。
游戏本身的战斗系统也非常独特，吸取了只狼等游戏的优点融入进本作，当然若是你用键鼠游玩一定要将除了wasd外的所有按键都改一遍。在战役中我们拥有两把爆弹枪与一把近战武器，将敌人血量削减到一定程度后敌人会变红进入可处决状态，我们可以隔着老远就按住处决键让我们的角色在无敌状态一个箭步冲上去进行畅快淋漓的处决动画，而且有一点很不错的设定是处决前会取消一切动作后摇。同时游戏中还有个弹刀机制，敌人攻击分红色和蓝色两种，当被攻击时会先看到一个蓝色光效，此时无论玩家处于什么状态，按下弹反键就会直接弹反成功，中间的判断帧给的相对充裕，除了少数连段攻击需要弹两次外，此时我们可以直接开枪进入枪决状态，不过既然枪决是远程处决，那把无敌效果删了也十分合理。同时游戏中没提的一点是红色攻击也可以完美闪避后接枪决，且这游戏所有小怪攻击都可以弹，因此理论上，注意是理论上我们只用近战可以达到这是我的回合，这还是我的回合的战斗。



然后其他设计决定了这套机制并不能完美运行下去，比如泰伦虫族一个虫子的造价在虫巢看来还不如一颗子弹昂贵，直接根你玩虫潮作战不好吗，因此在战役中星际战士面对四周包围的敌人与只能用枪解决的远程兵时也之后在部分间隙用用弹刀。且弹刀虽容易，但也要考虑失败的风险，游戏中玩家的受击受击硬直过大，且经常面对被包围的情况，无论何种难度，有时候一个操作失误就会被连死，这也导致玩家在不熟练的情况下也很少主动去使用这项能力。



不过游戏本身是非常鼓励战斗，我们星际战士首先是拥有一层护盾，无论什么处决都可直接回复护盾。盾碎后掉血后先是虚血，和血缘类似攻击可直接回复虚血，且本作的虚血是一比一保留且时间不短，有时在怪堆里拿大锤打小怪就是你打多少我吸回来多少。



然而本作在关卡流程中塞入了大量远程怪，让上述的很多战法丧失了使用空间，且这游戏的远程怪攻击频率与精准度不低。不过有个设定是击杀远程精英，旁边的小怪会自己死亡，然而这个教程藏在pve角色挑战中，可能制作组在这时默认大伙都是锤佬，知道虫族是蜂巢意识，死一个大工具点周围的小弟都会死亡。



以及制作组用脚填数值，目前部分武器平衡很差，热熔器灭一切，而该世界观中的能量武器在本作却效果一般。最高难度的怪物巨肉，ai和僵尸事件大战时的ai一样不干任何事情，只是有80%的减伤不怎么会死。不过战役总体而言还是建议大伙玩低难度，这样倒也符合原设定中星际战士的强度，毕竟战役除了成就之外并不会有其他任何奖励。若真想挑战高难度还是去pve模式中，毕竟pve后续想升级还必须打高难度，不要像我一样开局直接打最高难度的战役去坐牢，在这个过程中也无瑕欣赏战斗时的脚本演出。



关卡设计方面制作组还是僵尸世界大战做多了，很多关卡有非常强烈的既视感，总体称不上多好，中规中矩的水平。但部分关卡设计就有点粪，比如中间有一关需要手持彭喷火器在鼠堆里防守，在巨多远程怪的情况下需要时不时拿喷火器烧地面以放置机制杀，而如果你是带着两名ai队友打这关更是痛苦，ai什么都不干，输出和总机制只能全交给玩家自己。




本作的渲染风格很独特，不完全拟真，尤其是星际战士的盔甲，更像是使用各种阴影喷涂和做旧的战旗棋子，如果真让锤佬来玩估计单看各个皮肤都能看个好半天。且在pve和pvp中玩家还可自定义盔甲，这时也会发现游戏内战团颜色和现实中旗子油漆颜色名字一致。可能这也是一种商业策略吧，但总体而言不算坏。



不过这里也要引出本作在肝度方面的一些问题，目前首发版本战役和pve各6关，每关长度在一小时左右，而自定义盔甲的很多颜色都需要花费游戏内代币购买，而这个代币需求量十分庞大，目前区区6关的内容量真的很难撑得起玩家长时间的刷刷刷，且pve中每个职业的后续盔甲样式都需要胜利多少局才可解锁，总的算下来如果想全解锁至少需要玩家打204次pve，这真的有点夸张，明明最简单的把各职业的盔甲解锁变成通用就能减少一大半内容量，可惜制作组没有这样选择。



本作的PVP是较为传统的，也不作为制作组重点，很多功能就没想着去做，比如总战绩什么的，而pvp思路的话基本是必须抱团，星际战士的血量非常少，近战攻击还可直接穿盾，总体而言深度不高，不过我比较担心的是我在第一天打PVP的时候就遇到外挂，想举报却发现游戏内根本没有提供举报方式，遇到这种情况只能选择退出，不过退出倒也没有任何惩罚就是了。只能说制作组为了这个PVP而特意添加的小蓝熊并无太大用处，等一切尘埃落定后PVP除了大伙约着一起，不然应该是不太会有人玩。



不过值得一提的是经历过暗潮后我起初对本作的音乐抱有较高期待，但实际打通整个游戏后你问我星际战士2的音乐，我发现我完全想不起来这游戏的音乐是什么样子，不过相对的游戏的音效部分做的非常出色，爆弹枪这种大口径的初膛破空声、枪械内部机构的撞击声。还有个很细节的地方是在设置中玩家可以选择是否带头盔，而这也会直接影响角色对话音效。



总体而言本作是游戏工业下一个非常标准化的产物，有正常偏下的关卡设计，较为独特的战斗系统，也有战斗设计经验不足导致远程小怪强度略高。同时投入了较为充足的资源，且制作组内应该也有真正的锤佬提供想法，将这些资源也真正花在刀刃上，每关都塞上一些高质量CG；知道自己关卡做不好，那就狂堆演出；知道自己体量做不太大，那就在7小时的战役时间内将相关设计密集堆放；知道锤佬想看什么，那就着力在这方面；也知道考虑其他普通玩家的体验，就将整个故事以非常清晰的姿态展现在玩家眼中。这就在当今的欧美游戏业界就显的非常难能可贵了。

From the moment you step into your power armor, you’re no longer just a human, you’re a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ walking cathedral of destruction, blessed by the Emperor’s divine will. Xenos? Heretics? Chaos-worshipping filth? They’re not your enemies, they’re your next target practice. Reload, deliver, and repeat until the galaxy is cleansed.

The Combat
It’s pure, undiluted rage made flesh. You don’t just kill your enemies, you annihilate them with every pull of the trigger, as if the Emperor himself is screaming “Purge harder!” in your ears!

It's simple, if it’s not human, it dies. You don’t need context or a reason; they’re xenos, they exist, that’s enough to condemn them. You are the Emperor’s fist, and the galaxy is your punching bag.

Warhammer Space Marine 2 ist ein fantastisches Spiel, das in fast allen Bereichen überzeugt. Die Grafik ist beeindruckend, die Sounds sind stimmig, und die Waffen fühlen sich einfach großartig an. Ich habe die Kampagne auf der höchsten Schwierigkeit durchgespielt und aktuell zwei Charaktere – einen Verteidiger und einen Zerstörer – auf Level 25.

Die Kampagne ist hervorragend umgesetzt und fängt die düstere, epische Atmosphäre von Warhammer perfekt ein. Man fühlt sich wirklich wie ein Teil dieses riesigen Universums – einfach fantastisch. Auch die Koop-Missionen sind sehr gelungen und machen eine Menge Spaß, allerdings sind die Chaos-Missionen noch etwas unausgewogen.

Der PvP-Modus ist unterhaltsam, aber es gibt noch Luft nach oben. Mit nur drei Spielmodi und etwa fünf Maps ist das Angebot noch recht begrenzt. Zudem fehlt es den Chaos Marines an Anpassungsoptionen, was dem PvP etwas an Tiefe nimmt. Hier sehe ich die größte Schwäche des Spiels.

Das Spiel läuft außerdem extrem stabil. In meiner gesamten Spielzeit hatte ich nur einen einzigen Bug, aber keinen Absturz oder sonstige Probleme – es ist wirklich sehr gut optimiert.

An alle, die sich beschweren, dass es keine Pronomen, Frauen, LGBTQ+ oder andere Repräsentationen gibt: Im echten Leben könnt ihr all das gerne so ausleben, wie ihr wollt, aber in Warhammer geht es nur um Krieg! Lasst das Universum so, wie es seit den 90ern ist. Wenn es euch nicht passt, sucht euch bitte etwas anderes und lasst uns unser Warhammer so lieben, wie es ist: düster und gnadenlos. DARK and GRIM.

Trotz kleinerer Mängel ist Warhammer Space Marine 2 ein großartiges Spiel, das ich jedem Fan des Universums oder Action-Gamern wärmstens empfehlen kann.

O jogo não vale R$200,00.
Pagaria no máximo R$100,00 por ele.

* O jogo está extremamente repetitivo, apenas 6 mapas para um farm gigantesco.

* A quantidade de bosses no jogo é mínima, e praticamente todos tem as mesmas skills.

* O jogo não tem um equilíbrio descente entre os mobs, seja minions ou mobs maiores. Os minions dão dano igual ou superior ao dos bichos maiores.

* O jogo não te da informação suficiente relacionado as evoluções das armas, deixando um limbo gigantesco nesse sentido.

* As informações sobre o poder de fogo das armas não parece estar certo. Você coloca elas no lvl máximo e quando usa elas em lvls mais baixos, preciso dar a mesma qtdade de tiros ainda para matar os mobs.

* O esquema de esquiva e bloqueio do jogo precisa ser aperfeiçoado.

* A skill do assaulto está uma avacalhação, as vezes funciona, as vezes não. O que acaba te levando a morte em algumas situações no jogo.

* Ou você joga com a arma melta, ou você não faz conteúdo endgame.

* Assault tem uma vantagem que diz: Ao realizar ataques carregados, vc n perde o controle ao sofrer golpes pesados e não pode ser empurrado. Mesmo com essa skill ativa, vc é empurrado e perde o controle TODA VEZ, inclusive por minions.

* Os níveis de dificuldade deveriam ter um lvl mínimo para entrar. Muito player querendo rushar lvl e querendo ser carregado em dificuldade mais alta. Atrapalha demais o jogo ao invés de ajudar.

Если тезисно, игра прям сделана по ГОСТУ 2010 года, геймплей чисто консольные игры того времени по типу; Gears of War или Transformators War of CyberStyl.
Кишко-образные локации начиненные противниками разной степени впитываемости урона, подбираемое оружие на локации, сегменты где ну... обязательно надо что-то оборонять, сtrl c+ctrl v и игра готова.

Да, разработчики пытались привнести "новшества" по типу парирования, блока, там... ультимейтов, сочных добиваний которые быстро приедаются, но игра прям веет душком того времени, и это , игра добротно сделана и все же если опустить подьебки в ней есть кое что aхyительное, из WWZ.
Когда на тебя, чела в костюме из комикона (потом объясню почему) несётся рой мелких мразей, которых действительно ДOXYЯ, И ТЫ МОЖЕШЬ ИХ ВСЕХ РАЗОБРАТЬ ПО КОСТОЧКАМ, это подкупает.
Из-за этого в битве ощущениe по типу НЫА НА БЛЯTЬ НА НА ХYЙ УМРИ Я EБAНУТЫЙ. Импакт в игре хорош, звуки бахают и трахают, количеством крови на экране можно перекрасить черное море в красное, космодёсны орут что есть мощи в пылу битвы, вообщем шик.

В игре мало видов уникального оружия (все модификации болтера это не отдельные пушки, сразу говорю), и мало разновидностей врагов.

Про сюжет мне сказать нечего, в силу того что я свечку над 55 толмутами лора не держал, отсылки на знаковые события игры не выкупил, (да и я обычный человек поймите) кроме в голову ничего не приходит.
Классические терки внутри коллектива чтобы придать команде дуболомов хоть чуточку глубины, поиск в течении всех миссий чего-там, сказать кому-то что, неожиданный там поворот, эпик батл в конце с огромной кокус биг чуси болс крагозяброй the end. И разумеется люди доeбутся что у меня комп древнее палеозоя, но почему то не у меня одного проблема с недогрузом текстур. Почти все прохождение земля напоминала пнгэшку сартира в приближении Х100, а космостарсы выглядели как нечто среднее между Базом Лайтером, и сыром ( и да игра на SSD 980 SASUNG стоит). Обожаю лого амд перед игрой, прям стандарт качества.

Warhammer 40k : Space Marine 2

Kötelező darab konkrétan mindenkinek aki szereti magát a Warhammer világát főleg , de aki 1 tartalmas játékra vágyik és a mindennapi stresszt kívánja levezetni 1 gyors kikapcsoló darálással annak is érdemes ránéznie. Nem fog csalódni .....

Kampány kicsit rövid , de tartalmas mindamellett Co-op ban is kitolható másik 2 haverral , és ha kivégeztétek a fő szálat akkor jön a lényeg merthogy a kampány az igazából csak a bemelegítés kedvcsináló ha úgy tetszik.

Co-op küldik van a játéknak 1 része amit a Warhammer 40k Darktide hoz tudnék legjobban hasonlítani csak Space Marinokkal. 6 különálló kaszt szintezhető, testre szabható mind külsőleg mind belsőleg jelenleg 6 különböző pályán, és külön nehézségi fokozatokon 3 fős csapatokban. Nem mellesleg van a játékban PC-konzol crossplatform

PVP Része a játéknak kicsit unbalanced és ebben a modeban csak külsőre szabhatod testre karaktered sajnos és itt nincs crossplatform . Sokat nem játszottam vele , talán nincs még úgy kiforrva mint az 1. részben.

Valamint az összes fontosabb tartalom ingyenes lesz. A szesonpass kizárólag kozmetikai elemeket fog tartalmazni . Amit viszont a year one battleplan nem tartalmaz az az , hogy a fejlesztők nyitottak az új kasztok felé is és ehhez a közösség ötleteit várják aminek személy szerint nagyon örülök , de ez mellett új mappok új pvp mappok , ellenségek game modok várhatóak teljesen ingyen !

«Сожги еретика, убей мутанта, преследуй нечисть. Мы врываемся в самую гущу боя. Мы не отсиживаемся за укрытиями, мы всегда идем в атаку! Да устрашатся нас враги наши, ибо мы — гнев Императора! За Императора! За Империум человечества!»

— Призыв Ультрамаринов

I have been hoping for a sequel for space marine for 11 years, I have been waiting for this to release for 2 years. Does it deliver? I will explain below, starting with the campaign, then the MP modes ending on the technical details and overall thoughts.

Campaign


Space Marine 2 puts you into the armour of a Space Marine 40.000 years into the future. A genetically engineered super soldier that is 3 metres tall, a space marine is almost indestructible, they are faster and stronger than any normal human and some of them can be hundreds of years old. They are wrapped in myth and legend and are skilled warriors beyond measure. They are a bulwark against terror in a universe that has known only war for centuries.

Humanity is fighting against horrors beyond their comprehension and while there are several factions of said horrors, the main one we're dealing with here, is a Tyranid Hive fleet.
Tyranids are a bug/lizard like faction that swarm the universe to consume biomass, they evolve at an incredibly fast rate and can counter almost any known weapon or biological agent known to mankind and speed is of the essence when dealing with them. A planet attacked by them never truly recovers and there are millions and millions gunning for you.

The story picks up quite some time after Space Marine 1, and you are Titus. While I won't go into much story detail. The tutorial and thus the introduction to Space Marine 2, immediately shows what stakes you're up against and sets the tone for the entire campaign.

The campaign is a great introduction to some of the scale that Warhammer 40K offers and its bleak hopeless setting, there is only war and it shows. The campaign is filled with gigantic set pieces, wild lush alien forests and jungles, gigantic cities with massive cathedrals or abandoned bunkers and dark secrets. Everywhere you see signs of the carnage that happens all around you and the grimdark setting that 40K invented really shines here.

Gameplay wise the game is reminiscent of Space Marine 1, just improved upon. combat is fast and diverse and the game expects you to switch tactics on the fly.

As a space marine you have a great arsenal of weapons to use, from the infamous Bolt weapons, massive assault weapons that fire a bolt, a massive rocket propelled round that embeds itself in the target and detonates, to melta guns, plasma guns, heavy bolters. But you also have several melee weapons, from the Chainsword, to the Thunderhammer. Why? because the combat in this games switches between thinning out hordes and hordes of enemies before they reach you and then turns into a hack and slash brawler fest.

The combat is incredibly dynamic and it keeps you on your toes especially on higher difficulties. Luckily you are not alone in this rigorous slaughter fest. Titus has two other space marines with him, which can either be controlled by your friends or the computer. While the bots lack some finesse and tend to focus on direct threats, they are a welcome addition. Just don't expect too much of them, they are bots. they beeline for you to get you up if you're down but not out and they can distract some enemies.

The campaign will take you around 10 to 12 hours to complete and my time with it was enjoyed very much, I had several "Holy sh!t" moments and I felt like a space marine, the story is all I hoped for after 13 years and I loved it.


The multiplayer is the other part of Space Marine 2. It can be separated in two parts: PVE and PVP.


PVE is one of the parts that shines here, during the campaign several squads often help Titus with secondary objectives, the PVE or Operations gives you control of these squads. You can run this with up to two of your friends or bots, but trust me, play with friends.

You have six classes with each of them having a distinct role, weapon set and main ability.
From the standard space marine with bolter and chainsword, to the bulwark with shield and sword to a stealthy sniper

Each class has weapon upgrades, perks for the weapons and the class itself and customisation to unlock.
Yes you can create your very own space marine or unlock several other space marine chapters and customise those and while the customisation needs some polish, it's incredibly varied.

There are currently six operations most of which coincide with the campaign, they can take 30 to 45 minutes to complete and on higher difficulties they require coordination, tactics and sharing of resources.

They often feel like mini raids and they are incredibly fun to do, however in contrast to games such as Darktide I wonder how fun these missions stay, they feel less like a horde shooter and more like a mini campaign, while enemy variety and objectives can switch around in an operation, I feel it might get repetitive. Yet they are like I said incredibly fun and I will probably keep coming back to them, just because of the gameplay loop.


The second MP mode is Eternal War, a 6v6 PVP mode with the same classes as the Operations mode, just different progression. There three modes, King of the Hill, Seize ground (several points to capture) and Annihilation (team death match) and as of writing 3 maps.

The gameplay in pvp is great, classes are diverse and while some balancing might be happening it is incredibly fun to play despite it's lack of maps and modes. I spend several hours playing this and the tactical aspect in it is really fun, it isn't just run and gun, you have to counter other classes, bullwarks can block damage, snipers sneak around, assault's jump in to cut you down. There are tons of cool skirmishes to be found and it's an absolute blast.

However it's also the most bare bones part of the game. While the customisation for space marines is great, the chaos marines lack customisation, every class is attached to a traitor legion and is thus bound to it. You cannot play an iron warrior vanguard for instance and the armor itself is barely customisable, sometimes even not. For some of the more chaos minded players this can be quite a big letdown.

The other issue is that while it is 6v6 I can only make a lobby with three people, not six or four, locking out some of my friends to play with, I get it for PVE, I don't for PVP.

PVP feels like something added later in development and I hope that the devs do expand upon it with some much needed Quality of Life changes.


The game is quite CPU heavy, I have a i9-10850k CPU and a RTX4070 TI SUPER, the game runs like a charm in 90% of the game, but some areas and missions are incredible heavy on the CPU so much I wonder if it's a bit of optimalisation. Some area's that are small tank my frames, while some large open areas I run at a solid 80 FPS on ultra settings.

Besides that though, the game is beautiful to look at and effects, lighting, textures are all incredibly impressive, from the sparks of a broken cable to the blood that flies around.

The sound design is really well done and weapon sounds pack the punch you expect them to, every bolt fired, every enemy screech, every punch thrown is of high quality and this combined with the graphical design makes this a very immersive 40K game.


Despite some personal gripes and an in my opinion a bare bones PVP, this game has been worth the wait, it build upon the foundation of Space Marine 1 and improved it immensely. It offers something for older fans and something for newer fans of 40K and it is an incredible home-coming or introduction to the Space Marine franchise and thus Warhammer 40.000. It's an incredibly brutal, fun third person action game and the gameplay loop is quite addicting.

Sabre shows it understands 40K and this game is an ode to it.

Campaign 10/10
PVE: 9/10
PVP 8/10
Graphics 9/10
Sound 9/10

Overall: 9/10

Campaign: one of the best I've played in recent memory - this is the only part I can recommend
PvE: repetitive and loses steam after about 3 runs of each map
PvP: not my jam, no opinion, have not played

Overall the combat and general gameplay is some of the most satisfying I've seen since something like Gears but without all the cover nonsense and the first run of the campaign has some real jaw dropping moments in both visuals and reveals.

However, if you're looking for more than the campaign, this is hard to recommend. Much like Left 4 Dead, Back 4 Blood, World War Z, Darktide, etc, there's just nothing to do in the PvE Operations mode except grind out cosmetics and passives. That might be enough for some, but it lacks any of the systems that make something like Destiny, Warframe, Deep Rock Galactic, Remnant, or the plethora of other rougelikes out there that do so much with mapgen and other secondary systems that make each run feel like a run, not just going through the same motions again. I'm never excited by anything that's gonna drop from a mission, it's just "cross the finish line this many times" for your next passive/cosmetic.

Cosmetics are awesome, classes are fine, progression kinda sucks since you only unlock one row at a time. Not sure I'll be playing long enough to max a single class despite only playing two of them. Passives are... there? They all feel like relatively minor gameplay bonuses that help steer your playstyle, but not one so far has made me excited to unlock or feel it was worth working towards. They feel more like bypasses to some inconvenince rather than some Astartes-level power. I don't think I'd be able to tell an endgame level build from an early game one from gameplay alone.

Would be awesome if in new game + you could play the campaign with your custom marine so 60% of the PvE missions were playable with the PvE classes. I think that's my biggest issue, the best PvE content isn't what you get to replay for progression and what's there to replay gets stale fast. Really hope to see some updates to the operations modes that make them more fun to replay. Modifiers, loot drops that persist after a play session, consumable buffs, unique mission rewards, map variants, mapgen, really anything except playing the same mission over and over with some different combat pacing each time.

If campaigns are your jam, pick it up on sale. If you wanted something more replayable, wait.

Victorus aut mortis

This review is coming from a perspective of a 40k fan. I am relatively new though, only 5 years ago did I discover this universe, which is quite recent for a universe thats been around since 1987. Since my intoduction I have several painted armies (a space marine one among them) alongside having played some games and listened to a lot of Warhammer books and lore over the years.

Warhammer 40K : Space Marine 2 is a game that absolutely delivers on the experience it was aiming to create while going above and beyond for some aspects while fumbling tiny things along the way. I am pointing this out because this is getting increasingly unusual in the game industry nowadays. Most games coming out trying to sell you a live service while the game is not finished enough to be able to do so. Meanwhile this dev team seems to have taken their time to release a complete product that gives a solid foundation to making a live service work. 3 separate modes, all with a different focus and gameplay experience. Its quite refreshing, but that does not make the game automatically perfect. Lets talk about all of these modes and my thoughts on them.

Campaign: (no spoilers)

This mode continues the story of Demitrian Titus, the protagonist of the first game, with a fancy new narrative 13 years after the games release. Just like the other modes, you can play this mode cooperatively with 2 of your friends, and does a nice job introducing the mechanics of the game in a fun way. The campaign itself is short but sweet, and intentionally tries not to drag on to long, which is good in my opinion because you can't do much character work with a space marine because they are emotionless supersoldiers. The appeal of the campaign are the missions, and the set pieces within them. The 40k universe is bombastic yet intriguing and mysterious, and watching Titus and his team fight through futuristic gothic cities actively being destroyed by the tyranid invasion one moment and navigating through his chapters space ship with tons of details and lore is really fun and engaging. Its like a rollercoaster ride of the 40k universe where they show a lot of the unique and awesome stuff this universe has to offer. I do think it would have been smart of explain some more concepts, especially the ones directly related to the story's plot. A lot of times characters talk about in universe concepts, and people who are new to 40K will just not understand because its never explained. Its tottally playable and comprehensible to a person new going in, but I think its important to explain more stuff to really get them excited about the nuance 40k has compared to other sci-fi universes.

PVE Operations:
This mode allows your to play several missions losely related to the campaign story. Instead of Titus and his squad, you'll be able to play as 6 different classes, and make your own Space Marine. You'll be able to fully customize the look of your character, while completing missions allows you to level up and access new perks and abilities to make your guy stronger over time and really pick a playstyle you like. For 40k fans this is a dream come true since building and painting miniatures is a huge part of this hobby and the amount of customization is pretty vast for game that has just released. Its also not tied to microtransactions and all of the customization (except for a couple skins related to the gold and ultra edition) are earnable through playing the game. No ingame cash shop or lootboxes. The gamemode focusses on replayability with a good variety of maps, enemies and classes alongside the 4, soon to be 5 difficulties, makes it enjoyable over a long period of time. There is also an AI director tha mixes the missions up and tries to suprise you with changes in the enemies that show up and the objectives you must complete along the way. I have some issues with balancing though. The hardest difficulty feels very unstable to play right now, it feels you need to get lucky in order to win, but it’s very satisfying once you do. I also think the Thousand Sons faction are not very fun to fight currently of the way the units are balanced, totally fixable though. Focus has already promised to add more missions, weapons and enemies in the future which will be important to its life service, which in my opinion has the most potential in this game mode.

PVP Eternal War:

I played the least amount of PVP up until now, but it has pleasantly surprised me. It’s structured as a 6vs6 contest where Space Marines go up against Chaos Space Marines, marines who have betrayed the imperium and have sided with the bad guys. There are a couple modes to pick from, and they are all good fun to play with the same 6 classes from PVE. There only 3 maps though, and unlike the Campaign and PVE, there is not a lot of spectacle going on around or inside of them. Instead, this mode is focused on giving you a more competitive experiences, the 6 classes are all rebalanced to facilitate skill expression and game knowledge. The more you play, the more stuff you unlock for your class and once you get the hang of its surprisingly fun and way more intricate than you thought at first. Don’t overlook it, it might be really your thing.

Conclusion:

To me a perfect game is one that gets a lot of little things right, but at the same time, its art, and how it makes you feel is more important than examining and criticizing every detail. Space Marine 2 gives you the power fantasy of you being among the ranks of the Adeptus Astartes, something every Warhammer nerd fantasizes about ever since they started painting miniatures or reading/listening to the lore of this amazing universe. You get to go along this personal story of Titus to see something curated and then make your own based on the space marine you decide to make for PVE and PVP. The core gameplay is rock-solid and satisfying, with a lot of inspiration taken from DOOM while keeping its own style from the previous game. Artistically and graphically the game looks exactly like fans would envision the 40K universe alongside the overall sound design being a straight 10. The performance overall is impressive considering how many enemies can appear on screen on top of the orchestra of chaos that’s happening around you.

This by far is the best 40k game I’ve played so far and deserves all the praise and occasional criticism its receiving. I think thats because people, particularly 40k fans, care about this game and its future; the developers have created an awesome foundation for years of live service support and seem committed to fixing issues through their transparent feedback system. The game has already succeeded critically and financially, now it’s up to the devs build on it. If they do, and they are going to from the looks of their roadmap and their history as a developer, I’ll be there playing who knows how many years from now. If they somehow don’t, this game is still an incredible game and is easily worth the 60 you put in.

I recommend it, play it if your PC can run it. Thanks for reading this needlessly long steam review, but at the same time, what is wrong with you? You have wasted approximately 5 minutes not serving the emperor.... The inquisition is heading towards your exact location right now.

FOR THE EMPEROR!

Visually stunning, musically mediocre, audio in general is the worst part of the game.

Every single gameplay aspect has something holding it back:

- Melee (not enough stagger/damage on higher difficulties especially annoying with the hammer),
- Shooting (barely any gun feels powerful and most of them sound weak too, it's just a feeling though damage is ok)

- Executions/Finishers and other animations where you cant control your character do not have enough invulnerability frames so you take lots of damage without any means to avoid it.

In the end it doesn't matter cause you still feel like a Space Marine and some of the missions are breathtakingly beautiful, just not the second coming of Christ that most of people are telling me this game is.

edit:
- 8/10 if you co op this with a friend or two.
- In this review i'm talking only about the campaign, there are co-op, pvp modes i didnt play enough to have an opinion on them.

Many people and I emphasize this many people in these reviews clearly know nothing of what warhammer 40k is and it shows. This game is incredible for long time fans of the franchise and the combat is well developed with the alerts being more of a be aware as opposed to a perfect parry for larger enemies. if you ask me this is a 10/10 for any long time 40k fans. I am excited to see what saber adds. The people who cant play or launch probably dont have the specs for some considering my friends are able to play on a steam deck. For those who need it THIS IS NOT LIKE HELLDIVERS and others its an actually skill issue, learn the mechanics. Your input times matter deeply its based off the animations not just a ding and push. Listen to some lore videos before you jump in making comments its a very long and deep franchise.

Edit after a month. Opinions unchanged still recommend heavily. Sabre interactive listened to people and Everyday I'm counting down to the next content update.

En el momento de realizar esta reseña llevo acumuladas 13 horas de juego, principalmente en el modo Campaña y algo del modo Operaciones, y el juego, aunque tiene algunos apartados a mejorar, roza el sobresaliente.

Mi experiencia se basa sobre todo en el modo de dificultad Veterano y jugando con amigos en cooperativo, ya que pienso que esta es la auténtica y mejor experiencia que el juego ofrece. Superar al extremo una situación que parecía imposible y que todo tu equipo sienta la euforia de la victoria es una gran experiencia.

El juego es un portento a nivel visual, y al menos para equipos modernos está bien optimizado, permitiendo jugar en modo Calidad con bastante fluidez a la que tengas un equipo decente. La ambientación, el mundo de Warhammer 40K, los seres que lo habitan y la escala de sus conflictos están perfectamente recreados. Es increíble la cantidad de cosas que llegan a suceder en pantalla sin que el rendimiento se resienta.

Aunque el transcurso del juego sea lineal, los escenarios son bastante amplios, ricos en detalles y tienen bastantes recovecos donde se esconden alijos de armamento, recursos o secretos. Dicho esto, en este caso la linealidad, lejos de ser algo negativo, le sienta perfectamente al juego, ya que la intensidad y la tensión del conflicto se perderían con un mundo más abierto. Tal vez sí estaría bien contar con mayor exploración y opciones en la Barcaza, pero es algo que ya está planeado para futuras temporadas.

La personalización de los personajes de los modos multijugador está bastante bien, aunque echo en falta más variedad de piezas, y sobre todo poder cambiar el rostro del personaje (¡Quiero a mi lobo espacial barbudo y pelirojo!), pero confío en que estas opciones que faltan lleguen con expansiones de contenido.

A nivel jugable ofrece un sistema de combate bastante más profundo de lo que cabría esperar en un principio, ya que cuenta con un sistema de combos en el que puedes detonar un ataque potente en cualquier momento, de forma que cuanto más esperes para hacerlo mayor será el riesgo, pero también el daño causado a los enemigos. Por ejemplo, si lo detonamos en el primer ataque, daremos una patada, en el segundo un empujón y en tercero un pisotón que lanzará a los enemigos por los aires y los aturdirá.

También cuenta con un sistema de bloqueos (parry) y esquivas, que bien utilizados nos permitirán también aturdir a los enemigos y acabar con ellos rápidamente, para regenerar nuestros escudos, aumentando nuestra capacidad de supervivencia.

En cuanto a las armas a distancia, la sensación a los mandos es buena, aunque bastante similar a lo que ya hemos visto en muchos otros juegos de acción. Eso sí, tanto en combate a melee como a distancia, el juego ofrece una enorme variedad de armas, así que tendremos que decidir cuál utilizar en cada situación o cuál se adapta mejor a nuestro estilo de juego.

Por último, en combate cada personaje o clase tiene una habilidad especial única que se tiene que cargar antes de ser utilizada, pero que nos permite en muchas ocasiones darle la vuelta a una situación desfavorable.

En nivel Veterano, el juego dista mucho de ser un mata-mata, siendo necesario analizar el entorno, identificar las mejores zonas donde buscar cobertura, o dónde emboscar a los enemigos, así como trazar un plan entre todos los jugadores para optimizar sus esfuerzos.

Como puntos negativos, destacaría algunos errores puntuales que hacen que nuestro personaje atraviese elementos que no debería, algún enemigo que se queda atrapado con algún elemento del escenario, unas animaciones faciales que podrían ser algo más expresivas y las desconexiones del servidor, que aunque no son algo frecuente, cuando ocurren son bastante molestas. También hubiese estado bien contar con algo más de variedad de situaciones, ya que a pesar de que cuenta con algunos momentos especiales, otros tantos se repiten demasiado. Y por último, algún menú puede llegar a ser confuso al principio.

En resumen, a falta de probar el PVP, y que algunos de los errores comentados se vaya corrigiendo, me parece un juego que todo seguidor del género de acción o del mundo de Warhammer 40K debería probar, sobre todo en su modo cooperativo, tanto en Campaña como en Operaciones, ya que es un juego bastante bueno y lo será aún más con las expansiones que están por venir.

I am struggling to find anything to complain about. My biggest gripe with this game is that I want more, and I think this is a good problem to have.

Encoutered a few annoyances:
- menuing not being too convinient (mostly, I dislike that it takes two screens to set the difficulty+mission combo in the coop mode - it really really REALLY should be one screen). I'd love to see this polished up.
- the game will queue you into lobbies where someone is already playing your class, forcing you to change your class. I feel like that's a bit meh, since I enjoy playing one class for long sessions.
- very rarely (happened about three times in the 18 hours I've played so far) the game will lock you in place for a few seconds after a finisher animation - you're invincible and it'll recover, but it ruins the momentum, allowing the enemies to move away, which is a slight problem for any melee class.

And that's about it. Everything else is awesome. This feels exactly how I'd imagine a supersoldier smashing through the battlefield. The combat system has this heaviness to it, and your hits matter. I haven't felt this much power in my hands since DOOM - and I'm glad to have a new game in my GOAT steam folder.

游戏的底子很不错，不管是音乐建模场景都做得很好很有代入感，战役的体验我能给八分，就是有点不够玩。
至于这个联机PVE模式，不管是奖励，难度还是服务器，三个方面都很让人不满意。
一，奖励层面
一把游戏辛辛苦苦打下来，流程基本上是30分钟往上，花了很多的时间精力，但是给的奖励很少。经验和货币都很抠，而且最让人恶心的是基因种子和武器数据都要你自己找，本来地图就很大了，东西要自己找，位置还是随机的有时候一把打下来还没找到。这点给人的挫败感特别强。
希望能做一些优化，至少改成一把打完结算就能给一个武器数据和基因种子吧。
二，难度方面
这个游戏的PVE难度真的是我见过最难的几个，玩家可以操控的角色的机体性能甚至没有隔壁暗潮的贼配军强，动作僵直很大，人物也很脆很脆，而且打高难度的话很难回复血量一直都是危险线。
还有刷的精英和小怪，你打精英就会被小怪潮围住，你清小怪就会被精英各种恶心，导致我玩起来觉得我被奸奇和泰伦霸凌了。你说你就算不是个爽游，至少也不能是个联机魂游吧，大部分玩家是想来解压来爽的，不是来赎罪远征来坐牢的。
三，服务器方面
这个服务器真的烂，我以为隔壁暗潮已经是亚空间服务器了，我打了200小时暗潮也只是偶尔会遇到掉线闪退连不上的问题。你这一个主打联机体验，长线运营的游戏，服务器比亚空间还可怕，不是卡加载，就是连不上。跟朋友联机不是他掉就是我掉，真的太差劲了。
只能说这游戏的底子真的蛮不错的，只要能把难度优化好，服务器整的正常一点，多给点奖励降降肝度，还是能变成一个很好的游戏的。在他把这一切做好之前我这个差评不会改的。

The long awaited sequel lives up to the hype.
As a 40K fan from the books to the games, I am overly pleased and blown away at the game's detail, gameplay and scope.

The gameplay is clearly a step-up from the simplicity of the first game, adding in just the right amount of abilities, combat mechanics and weaponry.

The campaign's story is hype and larger in scope compared to the first game.

The PvE missions which are closely tied to the campaign are impressive and fun (adds to replayability). At some points I was reminded of Destiny's raids in terms of scale and puzzles (just slimmed down). I am very excited to hear that more of these PvE ops will be added for free in the future. Eternal War PvP is short and sweet, along with what feels like a good balance of classes and perks.

The game's linear progression in the campaign and short single-player reminds me of games from a decade ago, matching the first game's length. If you really enjoyed the first one, this is your new best friend.

Technical issues like crashing in loading screens, crashing after mission completes, server drops, and other small bugs are occasional but not extreme.

As a 40K fan, this will be a game I will come back to for a long time. Even non-40K fans will enjoy this 3rd person action shooter.

let me preface this review, it is amazing fun, its beautiful on PC with smooth controls, its campaign is fantastic, a decent amount of customisation rounds it all out, I can see myself able to play this game for many hours.

However, there are some issues, some normal for any games launch as disappointing as they are, some decisions that are just outright stupid until these are fixed even though I love it I cant recommend it.

first and foremost, offline progress is not counted towards your account in operations, now some people have said its an anti cheating measure and I can see that perspective however it pails in comparison to the complete struggle that is trying to play the game in online, as you can expect, like many games of this era online play is wrought with server issues, disconnects mid session, finding it near impossible to get a game going, lag-spikes and jittering all the common symptoms, what this equates too is a game that forces you to play online to progress your account, while being barely able to support online play at all.

this carry's on, if you get disconnected mid session which is very common, you lose all progress, all rewards collected in the mission, you cannot rejoin the game in a standard manner, you cannot carry on the mission with bots in offline mode (even if you could no rewards are likely still an issue.) you get the pure pleasure of being told to go stuff yourself and restart from scratch, one only has so many hours in a day, don't make us waste them.

it is mind blowing to me how one can create a game as beautiful and fun as this and then completely drop the ball at what is completely bloody obvious, the game at launch WILL have server issues, so here's a crack brained idea, maybe don't punish all of your players for the possible action of 1% of players that will cheat in offline mode, in a PVE mission mode if that even was the reasoning behind this decision, its truly mind boggling, Total Biscuit would call it a piece of art with a dumb-ass poking holes in it with a pitchfork, Saber are actively harming players with weak or intermittent internet signals, which makes up a far greater majority, even when the server issues are fixed, which I am sure they are working on.

There are game breaking bugs as well, if you die in some campaign missions on harder difficulties, the ammo boxes disappear, with no spoilers, this makes the mission impossible to progress, not because you cant just chain sword them, but there are enemies and objects you have to shoot, with no ammo to do so.

until bug fixes are done, offline mode grants progression, the servers are fixed, and some truly baffling decisions are reassessed I strongly recommend waiting for the game to go on sale which by then it will hopefully be fixed, or borrow the game and enjoy the best parts about it offline.

you have every part of a great meal here Saber, stop messing it up, you are proactively harming players.

Uh...well...
There's Space marines

Oh and chainswords....
Mother
F*cking
C H A I N S W O R D S !

In all seriousness yeah its an alright enough game with a short but decent campaign (albeit some aforementioned cutscene errors or bugs such as where they either freeze but the audio continues or its the opposite of the audio lagging behind the visuals of a cutscene).

Combats fun allowing you to pull off some cool as finishers to enemies to regain health and shields (finishing moves in action games is always a win) but some of the controls can feel quite janky with awkward keybinds set by the game for pc.

The operations co-op mode currently has an error where you can get stuck in the hub after readying up for a level and would certainly benefit from some variety, otherwise the same 6 levels could get repetitive for some people, I like to think of it like its Left 4 Dead where you can play through the same levels countless times but the game play is what keeps it fun, but some more random/less linear objectives if possible could probably help make the levels feel less repetitive.
With hopefully some more content and additions operations mode can hopefully reach just a bit more of the potential that it does offer, but still simply just co-op romping with some friends or random allies and curb stomping aliens together are fun solid foundations, hopefully it can just be improved upon.

There's a PVP multiplayer mode where you play as the space marines faction or the Chaos marine (evil hellish marines) faction and fight each other. I haven't played much of it myself but yeah its alright, its there for those who want it.
You can't unfortunately customise the Chaos faction characters, you get premade models for each of the classes on that side, which while they do look cool themselves, does seam like some people are still let down that you can't customise them as well like you can with the space marines.
As far as I've seen theres not many like cool takedowns or anything you can do to enemy players, its just clunky space marines on both sides blasting or thwacking each other clumsily like its a call of duty game and using their ultimate abilities non-stop with no cohesion to see who dies first, then respawning with your abilities charged again to rush back into the fight and repeat the process. Yeah its alright for those who may like the PVP stuff but personally I think the PVE stuff's more the games strong point.

Both the Co-op mode and PVP mode have separate level progressions though so don't think you can level up a class in co-op mode then pop into PVP with a skilled up PVE dude and stomp fools, which is fair BUT however, while class level progression is separate for each mode. You can still unlock cosmetics currency and armour pieces for your characters just by completing matches in both modes as each character. So you can still play both modes and they still count for cosmetic progress at least for each class you beat a match as, so thats nice.

Yeah look, TLDR: Its a decent co-op game and being able to run around and stomp out enemies with allies while playing as giant f*ck off power armoured boys is still awesome. Heck I'm not a big Warhammer series fan myself meaning I knew bugger all about the lore, but I am starting to learn some things about the universe by playing this game and its encouraged me to look a bit more into it.

And you don't need to be a fan of the franchise or know everything to enjoy the game, I'm a simple fella, I saw big mech suits, chainsaws and brutally ripping alien scum to shreads... and thats all I wanted from it.

So its still a solid cool game to play and have fun wreaking havoc on enemies with your big space marine ruthlessness and brutality. But I think it would benefit from some more additions and content, the foundation is there, just build on it and add more levels, and maybe some variety in objectives to keep the co-op mode from becoming stale.

P.S The Season Pass content cosmetics have been a bit disappointing so far, Its just more colours and decals really, I was hoping for more unique/cool and actual standout armour pieces or such to justify its content but so far it leaves alot to be desired IMO.

This game has the feel and vibe of a game made in the late 2000s, early 2010s. The way the multiplayer and the PvE modes play wouldn't be out of place in that era, minus the graphics. This isn't as common nowadays, if at all. So in a weird way, it's a refreshing change that I don't hate at all.

The game currently lacks any microtransactions, and apparently there's no concrete plans for modern microtransaction models. You want new cosmetics? Play the game modes. You want new weapons? Play the game modes. This is good. I like this.

The gameplay feels similar to how the first Space Marine did, with significant improvements in some areas, and a few missteps. The biggest issue comes in the form of the difficulty, as some enemies are just obnoxiously too powerful on their own, with the methods that they swarm you making it all the worse to deal with. This really only is an issue I've found with the Tyranids. The moment you get to your second set of enemies, it's nowhere near as bad.

Also what is the point of a heavy bolter if a simple SHIELD can stop it?

Story is about 10 hours of gameplay (including doing the side coop missions at least once, that are part of the story, but also the content you grind after) and I enjoyed it for what it was. I think this is a great intro to the 40k universe/lore for people new to it.

The gameplay is fun and with the classes and guns available right now there is enough variation to enjoy and keep playing. Where the game does lack though, is the mission content. The re-playable/grind-able missions I feel will get a bit boring after maybe 20-30 hours of grinding them. There is some variation in spawns (elites/bosses can spawn in certain parts of the mission path) but with the few missions that you can run, it isn't enough. Granted the devs plan to expand this later.

There is a PVP mode that will extend the games life a bit but I am yet to try it, although I think it is probably gonna be quite fun.

The game looks beautiful and runs smooth for me (7950x3d, 4090FE, 64gb 6000mhz ram) with the only issue being - when I try to quit the game, it doesn't actually quit. I have to kill it manually.

Overall, id recommend this but if you are only here for the story - wait for it to be expanded with DLC releases or wait for the game to go on a 50% sale. I also got the ultra edition - don't do this unless you just want to support the game, the content it gives you over the Gold isn't really worth it.

Fantastic. It’s exactly what you'd expect from a sequel to 2011’s Space Marine and a Warhammer 40K action game. It takes everything that made the first game fun and cranks it up, refining pretty much everything that you remember about that original game.

I never followed the details about the story prior to the release so I wasn't sure if it's gonna pick up from where the last game left off. But I was pleased to see that not only does it still feature Captain Titus as the main character, but also manages to be an overall much better story with a couple of fun memberberries thrown in for fans of the original.

And if you're really invested in the lore, you'll be pleased to know that the developers poured a lot of heart and attention into making this an accurate 40K experience. It's probably the most authentic "play as a Space Marine" experience to date, because you truly feel like an eight-foot-tall truck on legs, towering over regular humans and barreling through everything like an elephant in a china shop. Including any living thing that isn't at least as big, because it's going to end up getting stomped like a grape. Everything about this game's design is just as over-the-top, excessive, and ludicrous as you'd expect, and it's glorious.

THE EMPEROR PROTECTS!

This is in my honest opinion the best Warhammer 40k game we've ever had. It does a lot of things very well, and very little outright bad.

The story is good but nothing mind-bending. There's the usual 40k war drama. A few nice twists, and some truly breath catching moments. All of that is if you're a fan of the setting.

If you're not, or yet undecided, then this is a very good entry point. The game does an amazing job showing the scale of conflicts that take place in the universe. Then it impresses you with its visuals and sound design and does not stop.


Things of note, multiplayer (both PVE and PVP) have customization, and the story clocked for me at around 12 hours at the hardest difficulty. Performance seems good enough, though people mention crashing and CPUs going very hot, so keep that in mind.

And well, that's it. It's a great game. It looks great, it plays great, and it sounds great.

Из сюжетки прошёл лишь пролог и первую миссию. Главный герой не бесит своими репликами, как в некоторых играх. На данный момент больше сказать по этому поводу нечего.
А вот пвп-режим очень даже порадовал и скучным не кажется. Пока что. Но встретить читера ещё до официального выхода игры, это какой-то анекдот. Или же багоюзеры уже нашли лазейки на бесконечные гранаты, не знаю.
В заключении скажу, что своих денег игра, конечно же, не стоит, как и ничего сейчас, бл#ть, столько стоить не должно. Space Marine 2 is easily one of the top games in the Warhammer 40K universe. After 13 long years of waiting since the excellent first game, it was absolutely worth the anticipation. To be completely honest, I got my hands on it early thanks to the leak in July, but since I knew I’d be buying the full version (and went all out for the maximum edition), I think that excuses my impatience. I simply couldn't wait!

Campaign

The sequel’s story picks up directly from the first game, even though about 200 years have passed in the timeline. The campaign is as grand as you’d hope, fitting perfectly within the Warhammer 40K universe. Blood, gruesome executions, and limb-tearing battles define this world, and the game delivers on all fronts. While it’s linear and heavily focused on combat, I found the whole experience a ton of fun.

Combat Mechanics

The combat truly nails the feeling of being an unstoppable, armored giant. From the moment you start the campaign it’s clear that you are super-human. The Ultramarines stand out from the surroundings and look like some sort of Titans, with their sheer size making them equals to the Tyranid warriors. The weight and power of your weapons – both melee and ranged – feel spot on, especially when playing with a controller (I’m using an Xbox one). Each hit, shot, and headshot feels impactful, and those bloody finishing moves? Just perfect.

Co-op Mode

A great addition is the new co-op mode. After the introductory mission, you can jump into the campaign with one or two friends, and it works flawlessly. It really amps up the excitement of playing together. If you're playing solo, the AI companions are excellent, so you won’t feel left out.

Multiplayer

And now for the real treat: multiplayer. If you have fond memories of the multiplayer from the original Space Marine, you’re in for a treat. It was brilliant back then and kept me entertained for hours. Now, after 13 years, we finally have what we’ve been waiting for. The multiplayer alone makes Space Marine 2 worth buying. If you're into the Warhammer 40K universe, there’s no better PvP experience out there.

In my opinion, it’s a solid 10/10. Definitely worth checking out!

Короче, определенно тянет на игру года. Разрабы с вниманием к мелочам подошли к игре и могу сказать, что вышло отлично.
Давно не получал такого удовольствия от геймплея и звуков игры.
Ты чувствуешь, что управляешь 300кг махиной и против тебя сражаются ничуть не менее тяжелые представители местной фауны, а иногда и флоры.

Хорошее музыкальное сопровождение, русская озвучка звучит замечательно, за весь сюжет встретил только один баг с взлетом всех персонажей в воздух, ито пофиксилось перезаходом в игру.
Я не прям задрот вахи и лор знаю поверхностно, но ощущения мира переданы на все сто и каждый чавкающий шаг по тиранидам ощущался каждой клеточкой кожи.

Немного про управление - на геймпаде не пробовал, но с компа надо привыкнуть или поменять под себя.
Лично себе настроил прицел на доп кнопку мыши, тк где-то на клаве его искать не удобно, особенно, учитывая обилие других нужных кнопок для игры.
Уровни сложности ощущаются тоже хорошо. На легком ты машина для убийств, на хардкоре ты космодесантник на последнем задании. Тебя сожрут столько раз, сколько того захочет Император.
Лично я выбрал нормал, тк хотел почувствовать игру, а не боль в промежности, но даже на этом уровне сложности игра бросает вызов.
Друзья у меня бедные, потому играл с ботами и... Они тоже не так плохи, как в условном пейдее.

Короче, очень советую, оно того стоит. За Императора

Игра офигенная по геймплею, есть свою нюансы на самом деле, но а целом ощущение положительное.

Плюсы:
1. МЯСО. Бой, добивания, охуенно лайк подписка
2. Сюжет компании - круто, интересно. В целом больше для галочки, но для фанатов зайдет
3. Разные классы - разный геймплей. Классы интересные.
4. Много скиллов на прока,ку, возможность прокачки оружия
5. Графика, оптимизация

Спорно:
1. Как то маловато выбора оружия на класс. Их можно качать, но в компании выбор больше. На самом деле это пока не бесит, но просто хотелось бы

Минусы:
1. Всего 6 PvE миссий, у миссий 4 сложности. На каждую сложность нужен определенный уровень персонажа и оружие чтоб ее вообще пройти. Ты можешь прокачать одного, если захочешь другого - все с нуля. С самой низкой сложности. Надеюсь с длс будет больше миссий.
2. Проблемы с соединением - надеюсь это из за раннего доступа, но тут все плохо. Если стартуешь PvE вдвоем постоянно кидает рандома, который не может подключиться, а ты в это время ждёшь. Потом его выкидывает, идёт отсчёт и коннкетится новый. И так по кругу. С PvP тоже проблемы, иногда зависает Коннект к матчу, приходится alt + f4
3. Миссии компании довольно длинные, сложность в компаниях не имеет смысла кроме как если любишь трайхардить. Плюшек за нее не дают.

Очень надеюсь на сезонный пропуск, в котором добавят больше PvE миссий и возможно новые режимы.

Speaking as a person who has invested far more money into tabletop warhammer than I care to consider, who has read dozens of black library books this game is the best representation of 40k I've ever seen outside of writing. There is so much love and attention to detail in this game that it could truly have only been made by people who are enormous fans of the setting. I don't want to spoil things before the game is even fully out but let me say the scene with the chapter banner was AMAZING and it might not have even been the coolest moment in the game. I constantly felt like I was seeing the stories and miniatures I know so well brought to life, it was a really remarkable thing.

The performance is also like, weirdly good? I only have a 3700x // RX 7800XT and it ran flawlessly all the way through the campaign at 1440P, on Linux no less. It's pretty remarkable. Really feels like the time they spent during the delay was very well spent indeed.

If you care about warhammer 40k literally at all I cannot recommend this game strongly enough. Even if you don't I'd say it stands quite well on its own merit as well

Après avoir passé plus de 16 h sur le jeu, je pense avoir un avis sur le jeu assez bon, même s’il reste quelques problèmes qui, je l’espère, seront réglés à la sortie ou peut-être via d’autres patchs.

Pour les points positifs : 

– Le gunplay est vraiment satisfaisant : par moment, on a vraiment l'impression d'être invincible jusqu'au moment où l'on tombe sur des mobs d'élite, où l'on doit quasiment envoyer 1 voire 2 chargeurs pour les tuer (ce qui est relativement handicapant quand eu en 5 balles nous met 1/4 life !). Mise à part ça contre les petits mobs ou même les boss, on voit vraiment une utilité à spammer avec son bolter.

– Ensuite, pour ce qui est de l'ambiance, musique, environnement, tout y est, c'est un réel plaisir en tant que fan de la licence de voir un jeu aussi bien fait.

– Une campagne super sympa à faire seul ou avec des amis ! (ce qui serait cool, mais surement impossible à faire, serait de rajouter des campagnes de chaque chapitre/légion mise à l'honneur, comme par exemple pour les Dark Angels qui vont être mis à l'honneur courant cette année, mais je rêve un peu trop).

Maintenant, on va passer au point MID, ce qui est bon, mais qui reste à améliorer : 

– Le système de customisation et de classe ! Alors, pour le coup, je m'attendais à quelque chose de fou quand finalement, je me retrouve devant une customisation assez limitée au début où l'on doit payer avec la monnaie du jeu (que l'on débloque en jouant, pas de soucis à se faire sur ce point-là), mais j'ose imaginer que sur le long terme, la customisation sera incroyable (petite pensée aux fans de Space Marine du chaos qui jetaient leurs larmes pour pleurer sur leur customisation ultra– Les serveurs/classes, je vais les mettre au même niveau parce que les deux sont relativement liés ! ET OUI comme dit dans les bande annonce il y a bien 6 classes mais sur les 6 il n'y en a que facilement 2/3 qui sont jouable sinon le reste poubelle ou presque et surtout comme je l'ai dis les serveurs sont de la partie donc ils suffit qu'il y ai 2 personnes qui veulent jouer la même classe en Opération et la partie ne peut pas se lancer et donc une grande partie des serveurs sont sois bloquer car les 2 classes les plus jouable sont prise mais j'ai bonne espoir que ça sera corriger avant la sortie du jeu 

– Un jeu (pour le moment très important à souligner), pour le moment assez répétitif, c'est-à-dire que vous avez 6 missions avec les mêmes objectifs à chaque fois, de temps en temps des boss qui se rajouteraient, mais pas de quoi casser 3 pattes à un canard. (Après, c'est une avant-première pour le moment, la road map est déjà sortie et il y a 4 saisons déjà prévues, donc que de bon pour le moment, y'a juste à espérer que les chiffres ne casse pas la dynamique, car pour le moment où j'écris ce texte, le jeu est très minimaliste).
Et maintenant les points négatifs à améliorer au plus vite, pitié.

– Le corps à corps ! alors très stylé le système de contre y'a pas a dire mais quand il y a une dizaine d’ennemie qui vous tire dessus et vous frappe disons que c'est assez compliquer de le faire ensuite truc assez bête mais imaginer attaquer un mob élite au corps a corps vous lui mettez 1-2 coups vous charger la troisième il vous envois une attaque qui vous stune et votre combo et complètement stopper sans que vous puissiez rien faire tout en sachant qu'il y a surement 2/3 ennemie autour de vous entrain de vous arracher le gosier d'une puissance jamais vu et la rentre en jeu l'une des deux classe jouable la classe rempart une classe avec un simple pistolet une arme au corps a corps et le saint bouclier qui augmente votre chance de survivre a ce carnage au contact de 10% à un solide 50% (je parle de la game entière évidement) et oui dans se jeu malheureusement il n'y a pas de système de défense simple des esquive ou bien le contre sinon vous subissez et vous pleurez en silence puis sans parler sur système d'attaque en générale qui lock absolument tout et n'importe quoi il y a un systeme de lock pour combattre comme il se doit un ennemie au corps a corps mais comme je l'ai dit en règle générale c'est pas du 1vs1 c'est du 15vs1 donc oubliez les assez vite sauf si vous jouez en pvp la il vous sera peut-être plus utile 

-Enfin pour moi le pire du pire c'est la vie elle disparaît si facilement c'est très très grave comme je l'ai dit plus haut vous allez tomber sur des mob élite qui en règle générale tank pas mal donc vous avez plusieurs option soit vous leurs foncez dessus et vous passez la moitiez de la game sans vie soit vous leurs tirez dessus et vous vous armez de patience et vous  envoyez 2 chargeur se 1 seul mob vont aussi vous allumer en moins d'un chargeur (L'avantage de cette option ce qu'il y a des munition tout les 5 mètres c'est a se demander comment elle se retrouve la par moment) alors que le heal et une précieuse ressource que vous trouverais après avoirs fini votre opération surement c'est tellement rare a trouver que si vous en avez allez jouez au loto vous avez vos chance ! il y a bien un bouclier mais honnêtement c'est juste visuel c'est juste pour dire regarder y'a un bouclier qui est complément inutile donc j'attend pas a avoir des ennemi plus nul non j'attend d'avoir un système de protection parce que quand au corps a corps c'est une orgie tous sur moi avec absolument 0 défense juste une belle épée tronçonneuse qui 2 shoot des petit mob alors imaginer mon état après avoir affronter 3 mobs élites au corps a corps ! Ce qui est dommage, honnêtement, on joue des space marines et je me retrouve à hésiter à affronter 3/4 ploucs qui vont surement tank comme des porcs, donc je ne sais pas : soit il faudrait rendre utile le bouclier, ce qui serait bien, soit peut-être augmenter notre résistance ou soit mettre plus de heal, parce que là, j'ai l'impression de jouer au petit chaperon rouge et je ne suis pas du tout le grand méchant loup.

Bref Beaucoup d’attente sur la suite des choses, en espérant que ça continue pour le mieux et surtout que le jeu fasse une bonne arrivée pour que le monde du jeu vidéo s’intéresse beaucoup plus au lore de Warhammer 40k !

Very bad servers, EXTREMELY long loading screens, PVP has 3 Maps with the most shallow design possible, no Ranked System or leader board or any Private lobbies, cant choose server location, constant disconnection. Some load out systems legit have 2 options only for PVP, and the second option is locked behind 20+ hours of grind. MUST MUTE ANNOUNCER IN PVP, the voice lines loop every time someone goes on the objectives.

Ai teammates are completely useless if you play solo, combat system tries to replicate Vermintide and Darktide but fails, The grey health restoration mechanic is minimal and the shields are obsolete as they get deleted in 1 hit. Higher difficulties are unbalanced because of the power scaling of your character, the upgrades are disappointing and lackluster, 5% melee dmg when mobs HP doubles does ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. No attachments for your gear, Perks have no choices, just linear upgrades with some special nodes.

PVE Operative mode is good tho if you have people to play with, Quick match is too slow and drops you into dead matches.

The Emperor protects. Running the game on 1660Ti. While keeping it on Low I am getting very solid frame rate. Loving it. The controls might be a bit odd until you get used to it but overall a great game.

Not a single crash so far or game breaking bugs.
